text: Average food, pushy service. I usually pay 50% less at good restaurants. The waiter was really successful at upselling us appetizers for more than 60$ alone, while sounding like it's free. I usually trust waiters, but this incident reminded me to be careful next time. Totally unprofessional.
What an incredible spot to stop in and grab a quick bit while taking in the quaint square and enjoying the entertainment.

We came to eat at his restaurant and the manager Alessio and the chef Marco was so amazing! They're so generous and the food was sooooo good! The service here is impeccable and he surprised us with a cake on the house you MUST come here if you visit vegas!

While walking through the Venetian browsing through all the options for dinner we came across this brand new gem!
The service was incredible and David our waiter took great care of us along with Ryan the director of beverages.  Ryan recommended an Italian beer I had never heard.
I had the pesto ravioli and my wife had the lemon risotto.  The ravioli was amazing and would definitely recommend it!
We started with some meat and cheese which would get again in a heartbeat.

The other 2 restaurants we wanted to go to had longer waits since it was happy hour so we decided on Mercato Della Pescheria. The restaurant was very beautiful and our waiter was very nice, he showed us around and we could to check out the pasta bar, seafood bar and dessert area! We ordered the Snapper Ceviche and the White pizza. The Ceviche was good but the pizza was nothing special. I was also let down because we ordered drinks and our waiter forgot about them and then came back 30 minutes after we reminded him and told us he was wrong, that the drinks we ordered were not a part of the happy hour. I would come back to try something else except there's so many other good restaurants in Vegas I probably wouldn't have to!

A new gem in the Venetian! Went with my girlfriends and the ambience was stellar! The food was delicious; we had the grilled seafood platter, which was amazing! The fresh pasta is to die for! The service is impeccable! We ended with the Italian espresso; best drink ever! We will definitely be back!

Had dinner here recently and was delighted with everything especially our waiter Marrow.  He was excellent and his knowledge of wine is unlimited.  I recommend you go and ask for him you will not be disappointed.

I don't usually leave a review but this place was so horrible, I have to say something. I wish I could give no star. So- maybe I can be ok waiting for a few minutes for the hostess to finish flirting with a European guy at the entrance and finally take us in when the manager saw the situation. But I'm certainly not ok to be ripped off by the waiter, ALEX, to bring us $10 bottled water when we asked for regular tap water. He never brought us the complimentary bread either, lied that the wifi wasn't working when asked for a password, and was certainly too busy to be caught after knowing we weren't ordering the "specials." Worst- since he earlier asked us where we were from, he thought that we were unexplored tourists from Asia with no understanding for gratuity?? (But we used to live in NYC over a decade). So by the time we were finished, he FINALLY showed up with the bill lecturing us on the tipping culture, and then directly asked us how much we are paying for the tip, so "I(he) can take care of it." WTF??!!!  I told him I'll fill out the gratuity on my own after the credit card was charged for the foods. And he goes, "Oh", and just walked away. What a snob!! Stay away from this place seriously. The food wasn't even that great (everything was too salty), and there are tons of great places in Vegas that treat you with respect.

I don't know if my waiter was from Italy or an actor hamming up a stereotypical assertive Italian waiter. Either way, his performance was the best part of the meal. This alone was worth one star above minimum (remember, yelp is a 4 star rating system. One of those stars can't be removed). My waiter made what was an otherwise bland and disappointing meal entertaining. I think he deserves better food to serve.

I started off with a cocktail. A simple old fashioned. What I received gave the impression that either their bartender or I have no idea what an old fashioned should be. I was thinking sugar, bitters, muddled fruit, bourbon and maybe some vermouth, simple syrup or a splash of water served on ice. What I got was a glass of water with Irish whiskey and a heavy portion of bitters and syrup. It's like they read a description of an old fashioned and ignored the pictures. I was happy to move on to the wine.

The focaccia was genuinely good. Some of the best I've had. But it was disappointing to get more focaccia instead of crostini with my bruschetta. There were 3 pieces of focaccia. One was topped with some sad looking tomato tossed with basil and oil. The other 2, I don't know what to make of it. One had some bland compote that looked like muffaletta and tasted of nothing. The last had beets that were boiled to the point where no flavor was left in them and then boiled again. I think the chef knew their limitation on beets and didn't know what to do after all the boiling, so they added a truffled creme fraiche to compensate.

For a main course, I went with gnocchi in bolognese. Common theme, the gnocchi was over cooked, but that's forgivable. What isn't forgivable was the bolognese. A large number of flavors converging into a single note where nothing is recognizable. A junk yard dumped on a train wreck. Never knowing where the tomato ends and the meat begins. Such a travesty they buried it under a mound of steamed spinach with stems. I thought the spinach might have been added to give a contrast to the one note bolognese. The contrast in color made the plate more attractive but the contrast on the palate made it in-edible. Thankfully, I ordered a high tannin wine to clear my palate.

I tried this place with a coworker while on business in Las Vegas. It look us a while to find it. It's located at the Venetian by the shops near the gondola rides. Wow! I was so impressed! I ordered the Shrimp Scampi and it was simply delicious! So flavorful and delicate. When I'm in Vegas again, I will definitely go back! The portions were perfect and our food came out in pretty good time! Check this place out if you're in the area and looking for some tasty Italian food!

Italia in Vegas!!!!!
Very good ITALIAN FOOD. Excellent service and superb ambience and decor.
Without any doubt I'll recommend this place.

Great restaurant, fun atmosphere watching the performers. The service staff made you feel like you were in Italy. We ordered the spaghetti and clam, seafood risotto and the New York steak. It was the best steak I have ever had. The steak was so tender. We ordered tiramisu and it was made table side. What a cleaver presentation. Great place. We will be back.

This place is just OK!  

Service is attentive.  Atmosphere is casual.   Bread comes in a can with breadsticks in plastic wrapper.  

Has seafood salad which was fine; seafood was fresh.  Also had seafood spaghetti; it was bland with no flavor.

If looking for a casual and lower priced Italian, can give it a try; otherwise, look around
A shout out to the best waiter ever- Alesia David! He made the experience of dining in the beautiful ST. Marks Square at the Venetian that much better. And the food was really good too!

The spaghetti and meatballs were really good! We went there just while walking by.  My wife has the mushroom risotto and really liked it.  Two kids had pepperoni pizza each and it was too much for each of them but not quite enough to share (Kids are 10 and 7).  The spaghetti I can't stop thinking about - hence my review!  Clearly fresh pasta and prepared perfectly.  The meatballs have a little spice and there were several!  Spaghetti and Meatballs was $19! How can that be beat?!

We went here Sunday  for a business dinner, there were 4 of us. Every thing was exeptional through out our visit. Our waiter ,Marco, welcomed us with a big smile and unique Italian accent. He guided us through the menu  suggesting us some amazing Italian cocktails and wines. He very well described us the dishes and suggested us to try the Italian family style so we could try a little bit of everything, from appetizer to dessert. We started with a seafood platter and loving that we then had some prosciutto and Italian cheeses. After that we had plin ravioli and spaghetti frutti di mare which was absolutely divine. Then we moved to entrees where we shared a prime New York Steak with a side of eggplant parmigiano and roasted potatoes. Then Marco suggested some good Italian desserts and after dinner cordials. The tiramisu was out of this world as well as the Limoncellos. To end we had a classic espresso. Everything was simply out standing. Marco was very kind and professional. Thank you so much for the amazing experience.

We stopped by for dinner. We had dinner there 10 yrs ago and it fabulous, not this time though. My beef carpaccio was so overdressed, not a taste of Arugula or goat cheese. The fried calamari has not much taste and no shrimp in it. Than the biggest disaster, we both ordered the Carbonora, it was so salty, my pasta was clumped together, no peas and huge pieces of pancetta, no elegance, after one bite we had to complain we were not going to eat this meal. We paid our appetizers and left. They offered a free dinner menu but we just lost confidence in their kitchen. The waiter was the only good experience and we would hire him if we had a restaurant ourselves. Please send your kitchen staff to Gordon to learn.

We had such an enjoyable experience! Nice atmosphere, off the St Marks Square plaza at the Venetian, great service and wonderful food. Different staff checked in during our stay to make sure things were good. Our waiter Matthew was very helpful and enthusiastic in making dinner choice suggestions.  We had a terrific gnocchi to share, and fresh spaghetti w clams and spinach ravioli w prawns. I had a roasted branzino (mediterranean seabass) and vegetables which was lovely. Desserts were very good, and large portions. The chocolate truffle cake was huge and the ricotta cheesecake was terrific. The tiramisu was a little too soggy for my liking, but the flavors were good. Overall a happy experience.

Mercato Della Pescheria-Las Vegas is hands down the best restaurant we have ever had the pleasure of dining at! From the ambience, the food, the dessert and the wait staff! Fantastic! Our server Arthur never steered us wrong, always sugguesting the best items on the menu! He was kind, curteous, and friendly! Just a wonderful server! Michele the manger was personable and charasmatic! Mercato Della Pescheria you guys really know the meaning of great service and phenomenal food! Thank you!

Ohhhh and the Tirimisu was out of this world! I strongly recommend ending the evening with this!

Beautiful restaurant with an authentic feel we tried many dishes and all of them were outstanding.  It wasn't just excellent food but a great experience from the fish market section to the pizzeria section everything was fresh and piping hot. One of my favorites was the ribeye steak and my wife loved the fettuccine Alfredo. Highly recommend this place for a fun atmosphere and a delicious meal.

SO in LOVE with this place!!!!  We started with the Crispy Artichoke and Roasted Octopus!  Both were amazing!!  I personally loved the octopus more, but you can't really go wrong with either.  For the main course we had the Veal Oso Bucco and the Yellowtail.  The Veal was... AMAZING!!!!!  Yellowtail was a awesome!  Clean flavor and fresh!  The staff there was great!  We brought our 6 week old baby to the restaurant and they accommodated us in the corner and had more than ample room to park our massive stroller at the table with us, all the staff was more than accommodating.  Everybody says Vegas is not kid friendly, let alone baby friendly, but this place was awesome for out little one.  See you guys next time!

This was a great place!  The staff couldn't have been nicer!  They gave us a nice table, kind of out of the way, but with a view of all the festivities in the Piazza San Marco.  We only had happy hour drinks and appetizers, but  they were wonderful and very affordable, especially compared with the restaurant just across from them!  We will be back and I highly recommend it to anyone!

I had an amazing time not to long ago. My server was Mauro he was out of this world. He recommended this risotto and paired it with this amazing white wine. Myself and my wife came in tonight to find that he didn't work. We stayed to eat anyway. It was good but not the home feeling you get when you get Mauro. His knowledge and service are amazing will only go when he works next time... I will definitely call ahead to make sure he works.

Our server Marco!! Was absolutely fabulous! He was so attentive and welcoming- our drinks were always filled and he explained every dish exceptionally well!!  

Thank you MARCO! I Highly recommend the Restaurant and ask for Marco!

I was disappointed in the food. I've been to many Italian restaurants and I would have to say this one does not stack up. I realize it's new so they need to perfect the recipes. The potatoes were burned. We also had the Bronzino which was way overpriced for the what you got. 
Don't do it! WAIT
Went there for Lunch during our stay at the Venetian!This Italian Restaurant is absolutely recommendable to all who love real italian food!It s placed at the Venetian Market Place!Love it

Good food and great service..  .
Thank you Alex!!  Fresh Oysters.. Will be back soon..

Great atmosphere and service.  You can watch the performances in the Grand Canal Shoppes.
Author provided great service and recommended the Fin Du Monde beer. Awesome!
Would recommend this place to anyone

Best Eggplant parmigiana that I have ever tasted. Great view and great food. Artistic interiors and friendly staff. There is a little show just outside the restaurant that added to the ambience. My girlfriend was in love with their Bellini. Don't forget happy hour 3-6pm!

Probably the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. We ordered fettuccine Alfredo with veg, oven baked veg pizza, eggplant parmesan and the ravioli. They all were delicious! Our server Mario took fantastic care of us.

We came here on a Thursday evening for dinner after reading all the wonderful reviews.  Unfortunately, neither the service nor the food lived up to expectations.  In fact, this was the worst meal we've had in Las Vegas.  My husband's Manhattan was delivered to the wrong table and sat there for about 10 minutes.  The waiter finally realized his mistake and instead of bringing a fresh one over, he just gave my husband the original.  We saw all this because there were not many customers around, and the other table was adjacent to our.  When my husband complained that the drink was room temperature when it should have been chilled, he claimed the drink was made as expected.  My husband told him it was not cold enough and the waiter took it back.  Instead of making a fresh one, we watched as the bartender poured the original back into the shaker.  A few minutes later, the drink came back.  We asked the waiter if it was a fresh one, and without pause, he claimed it was.  Food was also not up to par.  We ordered tableside pasta with cheese and black pepper, shrimp fettuccini, and seafood risotto.  The pasta with cheese and pepper was ok.  The shrimp fettuccini was nothing to write home about, with its dried out, overcooked shrimp.  The risotto was too salty, and the seafood overcooked.  On the plus side, the bread was nice and crusty, and the burrata in the burrata salad was very creamy.

Probably the worst Italian food on the planet. I think they used Campbell's tomato soup for their marinara. No basil, no garlic, no olive oil. I suppose they don't get much return traffic anyway. The horrible cooking is a disservice to a very good wait staff.

The atmosphere and the Italian Seafood was amazing. We shared a seafood platter that had lobster, halibut, shrimp, potatoes and asparagus and everything tasted very good. The staff was awesome and we had a cute waitress who gave us great service Manola and the manager Mirko was very pleasant and spoke about his country Italy and we left satisfied and welcomed. We will be coming back next time in Vegas.

Stopped in for happy hour to check the place out. Service & atmosphere inside the bar area was comfortably wonderful. Happy hour menu had some small bites & drinks for $6. Great deal but not impressed with the food. Ordered crab arancini  and mamas meatballs. Crab was good but meatballs were not. First time out they weren't cooked all the way. They were replaced with somewhat better 1 cooked 1 almost done. Regardless even if they were perfect they still would be the worst meatballs I've ever had. Won't be back to try anymore Italian items. If you can't cook a meatball forget it.
Side of eggplant parm was massive and tasty (spicy). Salad as only so-so. Service was good. Location is fine, in the Venetian, but the loud signing gets annoying.

This restaurant was truly the best meal and experience we've had in the dozens of times we've been to Vegas. I truly felt like I was back in Italy with my bellini, proscuittos, cheeses, and AMAZING olive trio. I, also, recommend the house burrata, seabass, and creamy polenta!!! Our server, Denis, was wonderful, and so was the staff we chatted with for a bit. If you want truly authentic italian dishes for a decent "Vegas" price, I highly recommend this restaurant!

Fun location on the square.  Watch the show while you have a nice lunch.   Food is good and nicely priced for the strip. Tried their lunch box combination and a nice way to get "just enough" 
 Great people watching, too
Alejandro was on the mark for service.  Friendly and efficient 

We would definitely go back

Great customer service.   Best Italian meal in Vegas with a nice ambience. Salads nice and fresh. Had a scooter for an injury and they were very accommodating. Went to trattoria and they literally turned us away because of the scooter.  Glad they did.

My family and I love this place!!  Their Italian food is probably one of the best here in Venetian and Palazzo and probably the Strip too!  We've tried Buddy V and lots of the other Italian restaurants on the Strip and this place is by far the best.  This place is located at the Saint Marks Square at the Grand Canal Shop open restsurant floor area where it used to be a Wolfgang Puk restaurant.  Although it is a fairly new restaurant at this place it quickly becomes one of our must go restaurant when we visit LV. 

We ordered pizza, spaghetti, risotto, calamaris, different pasta dishes, etc. here. They are all very tasty.  I love their pizza especially. Yum!

Their service is also excellent.  In our several visits there our server had been Victor and he was courteous and attentive.  He made our experience there even more memorable. 

Oh and they have very delicious candies that you can take with you after the meal to enjoy. 

Love this place!  Will definitely continue to visit them when we are in LV!

Dined here on 3/10/18 during lunch and was served by Brian. Everything was amazing.. had the pesto ravioli and it was simply delicious. Brian was very attentive and helpful. Will definitely be returning on our next visit!
Very recommended!!! Great food and great service!!! I ate the spaghetti frutti de mare it was delicious! Definitely I'll come back again

Stumbled upon this place at St. Mark's Square inside the Grand Canal Shoppes at The Venetian, and it did not disappoint. The staff and servers were very warm, accommodating and fun. Nice ambiance for a group brunch, and we didn't have to wait at all on a Sunday to be seated. A few highlights: 

Tiramisu French toast - AMAZING. One of the best french toasts I've had. The toast is crusted with lady finger cookies and topped with custard and whipped cream. Delicious - recommend sharing with the table as it is very decadent.

Pizza - We had it as a group appetizer, also very good! Stone oven cooked, thin crust and yummy cheese and sauce. 

Calamari - 5/5 standard, solid calamari. Pro tip from the waiter: squeeze the lemon in the sauce so the calamari doesn't get soggy. 

Pasta - we had the seafood spaghetti and carbonara with pancetta- both delicious and the pasta was sooo fresh and yummy as it is house made!

Aperol Spritzer - Refreshing aperol! Nice sub for the usual mimosa or Bellini. 

Overall super excited that we randomly ran into this place and will def be back next time we're in Vegas.
Best location in St Marks square,  delicious homemade tasting food, lovely warm friendly servers esp Manola.

The tempation of Tiramisu made at your table hooked us. We had dinner here on a Saturday. A reservation got us a great table outside under the almost real Italian dusk with an opera singer and music.

Menu is newly introduced. Doesn't have the Paella, I saw in other reviews. We ordered the Swiss Chard Ravioli which was excellent. The Mediterranean Rissotto was nice but I wondered if the Rissotto needed a little softness. We had the cheese pasta that is made at the table. Matt was an excellent waiter and had the right recommendations. We enjoyed the meal and will definitely come back again were we are in Vegas.

Stopped by for their lunch, had the salmon which was cooked to perfection.

The plate the salmon is served on has a smear of carrot puree which was quite amazing to put on the Salmon, with tuscan kale which almost tasted just like spinach -- great combination.

Service is slow, and they also screwed up a buddies meal who happened to be glutten free and vegan, whereby they cooked his pasta with butter.. They took full responsibility and covered the tab entirely for a table of four. The problem was since service is slow, and because my buddy had an appointment at the "art of shave" he was unable to eat. If service wasn't so slow, and they reduced their mistakes; this would of been 5 stars 100 percent.

This was a delightful experience- we were greeted by our server who made us feel as though we were truly in Venice.   An appealing ambiance with an acceptable noise level allowing table conversation. The menu offers many choices but our server, Manola was very helpful offering suggestions on her favorites as well as popular choices. I had the Sardinian stew which was flavorful- the seafood fresh abd the saffron not overpowering. My companions enjoyed the sea bass which was beautiful in presentation and very flavorful and fruti del mari, also flavorful. The wine list is full of good choices at reasonable prices. Overall, a great experience enhanced by a wonderful food and server!

Great comfortable Italian seafood restaurant with another location in Miami. We started with the Burrata salad which was drizzled with truffle oil and infused with truffle essence. I usually love burrata, but this one was a bit milkier than ive had in other restaurants. Once you break the firmer outside it spills out a softer inside. Considering its texture I thought they made it in house, a las it's imported. 

I chose the salmon entree which was really good and cooked perfectly didnt care for the small chunky bell peppers that didnt add much to the dish and seemed like an afterthought. 

Server was pleasant, but ill add at some restaurants you want the server to guide you through the menu or at least tell you about the restaurant. Tell me about your favorites and whats new on the menu. Eating at a restaurant is like shopping at a store: if im walking in for the first time sell me on it. Otherwise, you're just an order taker and the experience isnt exactly memorable. 

Would i go back? Sure, food was great.

Wow, what an amazing experience. Our server Jeremy was one of the best servers we have ever had and that's coming from servers from Boston. We got the mussels that were too die for. We enjoyed every single plate that was served to us. Everything came out in a timely manner. They opened 11 days ago and I was very impressed with the level of knowledge Jeremy had with the menu. He was spot on with everything. Boy did we hit gold coming here.

Had dinner here not to long ago and had the best service ever.  Mauro was our waiter and he made the dining experience wonderful.  He was so knowledgeable about wine and made the perfect suggestion to accompany our delicious dinner.

Very nice place with good food and great service!
Alessio was a great (Italian) host for the evening. Definitely recommended!
Very good high end Italian restaurant. Good service, nice interior and the great tasting food. The only average was the bread served at the table and the olive oil. Had better.

Great guest service delivered. And yes, great pizza and pasta. No longer want to eat cheap pizza/pasta at any other place...
Definitely a must try

Was a surprise how good this place was. Would expect a restaurant in a food court to be terrible but they were great. Bruschetta, Lasagna and Chop salad were all great.  Service and ambiance were good too. If you are in the area stop by!

OMG! The food was amazing as well as the service. When we arrive we were treated like family. Every bite was delicious and it was as if I walked into an authentic Italian restaurant in Italy and "mama" was cooking. The tiramisu at the end of the meal was spectacular! I will definitely return the next time I'm in Vegas!

I'm Italian, and there's nothing authentic about this place. My food was terrible. Everything was extremely over priced for the quality I was getting. $19+ for a Small pizza. $25+ for Spaghetti. The server was very pushy and annoying he came to our table and kept forcing more drinks on us. Overall, the only nice thing about this place was the cute Italian decor, but the food was not that good.

I was at the canal in venetian I find at new place to eat. They yes open, Mercato Della Pesheria.
I eat branzino that was wonderful the best i ever have the oyster were very fresh and tasty.
I get to the door and gentlemen come to me very energy.
Super super customer service and introduced their self.
Mirko the manager was super helpful and very funny and Alfonso the server gave me the best suggestion they're very friendly and pasión and with a lot of energy!!!this 2 napolitan guys made me very happy and laugh 
I enjoy every step of my experience in this.
Thank you.

Replacing Wolfgang Puck's previous Italian fare, this place fits the bill. Designed as an old world Italian marketplace for fish, meat, deli, etc.... The menu is short,  concise and well put together.  Authentic flavors come through without the need to force it in the atmosphere.   They've been open for just two weeks at this point and look destined for success as the service, drinks and entrée all go above average.  If you come in, ask for David R., he is attentive, sociable and helpful without being overbearing.  Nice.

came for lunch. nice "outdoor" seating and pretty good service. 

Food was pretty good but not mindblowing. For the price, i expected more. To start, we had the braised octopus, which was super tender and flavorful but was on the "burnt" side. 

for mains, she had the clams with spaghetti. Sauce is light with bright notes of clam, not over buttered or too garlicky. I'd say this was the star of our meal. 

My pesto ravioli though was lukewarm. They waited too long to take it out. By the time I ate it, it was a bland, room temperature mess. 

We also shared a generous side of cauliflower; again, this was only OKAY. nothing special.

Atmosphere is great of course ... good happy hour from 3-6 pm including some appetizers.
My pasta was made tableside inside a carved out wheel of Parmesan (which they scraped the walls for the cheese then added the pasta inside)
Definitely recommend

"Welcome to the family", this is how I felt when I got to the door!  I went to dinner with friends the other night and I was Amazed!  First of all they are located in St. Mark's Square at the Venetian Hotel Resort & Casino.  St. Mark's Square is a replica of the original in Italy, they have cobbled stoned floors, and the ceiling is painted like the sky, giving you the feeling of being outside, Beautiful!  As we arrive, Mickey was at the door and welcomed us!  The start of "Welcome to the family".  I felt like I was seeing a long lost friend or relative.  He greeted us all with warm handshakes as he walked us in to our table.  On the way, we were introduced to Mirco, who was also family friendly and filled with information.  They actually walked us around showing us the different stations they have; fresh pasta station, seafood station, cheese station, charcuteri station, I mean they have it all!  ALL PASTA MADE FRESH IN HOUSE.  We enjoyed Ravioli, Pappardelle, and Gnocchi, Loved them all but the Ravioli was my favorite!  The Prosciutto MELTED in my mouth! From oysters to calamari to shellfish, there was nothing that let me down!  This is a must while in Las Vegas, as for sure a MUST when visiting the Venetian Grand Canal Shoppes!

I loved this restaurant and had a great anniversary dinner here! It is very spacious, with indoor and "patio" seating which is located outside in the shops where you can people watch. The tables had a checkered table cloth, candle, and cute little old tomato can that held a baguette with olive oil and balsamic. The restaurant itself is huge, with 2 bars and plenty of seating available. It has a great location in the heart of Venetian.

I had the mussels which came in a tomato wine sauce. The seafood linguini had such flavor and the lobster pasta was tasty. All of it was great. The food came out quickly and our server Derrick was friendly and attentive.

I HIGHLY recommend the tableside tiramisu. It isn't anything like I've ever had before. They came to the table with a bowl of lady fingers, drizzled hot espresso over the fingers, started hand whipping the cream that goes on top, then shaved chocolate as a final touch. DELICIOUS and a must have when you go! 

I finished dinner off with a limoncello shot, and it did not disappoint!

The atmosphere was a romantic, authentic, upscale Italian restaurant.

Ambience is 5 star,  located in a really beautiful mall! The food is 4 star. Good taste but for example the cheeseplatter were very small compared for what you paid, i expected more food on that one. 
All other meals were good sizes. 

The thing that really annoyed me was that our  waiter by him self put 20% tip on the bill. I think that  schould be up to customer to write and deside themselfs.

Start with the ambience of St Mark Square and you cannot go wrong.   Grab a quiet table and rest a bit.  Quick attentive service.   Nicola set us up with some tasty Prosecco and then eventually with Peroni.   Apps were good - calamari crisp and flavorful not too oily.   Meatballs tasty with excellent marinara.   Gotta use that bread to mop up the leftover sauce.

Lunch entrees all were a hit.   Got the 2-for specials.   Mixed salad and Caesar both fresh and crunchy.   Prosciutto sandwich a great mix with arugula.   Halibut excellent as was the chicken.   Nothing we had missed the mark.

Not cheap but worth the stop for good food good service and ambience as if in Italy.

Try the sea bass and tiramisu next time 

Thank you to Nicola and also Brendan for taking good care of us!

Best Caesar Salad in awhile. Delicious rib eye steak and a great service team. My wife also enjoyed her dish of Linguini Frutti De Mare.

Great location in the "Grand Canal" for both people watching as well as the occasional show they put on in the Square.    

I have eaten at several of the restaurants in the "Grand Canal" although they all predated my Yelping days.  This one was my favorite back then, great lasagna, and is still highly favored.

We spent our Christmas ev in this great restaurant . The Food is just excellent. You should try their pastas, just amazing. Don't miss out of their Tiramisu being made right on the table. Our server David was just amazing, very professional and knows his job so well that every single person in our group of 12, felt very special.  A big credit to the manager, Mirko Cipriano, he made our Christmas ev in Vegas very memorable with his great attitude, humor and excellent service! Don't miss this place when you visit Vegas!

Amazing! Normally food quality and service are the top factors for me, but in this case the ambiance stole the show. It's just a delightfully perfect place to have dinner.  Food was good too. Huge portion of chicken parm and while it was a bit too simple, it was still tasty.

Great Italian place. We went for happy hour and we loved it. We had the mini calzone, crab arancini, and grilled octopus. All very good and reasonably priced. Our waitress was from Milano and the chefs are also from various parts of Italy, so it was a very authentic Italian cuisine experience.

Such amazing food! We tried a variety of foods and everyone was happy. The pasta was some of the best I've ever had. Tiramisu was something I will dream about. Waiter was great! Wish we lived closer and could come more often.

You get a complimentary can of pretty bland and small slices of bread.... after 15 minutes... good start :|

Calamari was just a few pieces, with some flat boring breading... minimal salt.... rest was a bunch of potato chips ... WTF.. sauce was good tho. 1 overcooked shrimp :/ was also included.

Carbonara was too salty. And many of the pastas were bunched up and dry/hard ... !!! That's pretty messed up for the price of this joint.

Seafood pasta had a lobster plopped on top, and a few clams. This one had good sized and correctly cooked shrimp. Pasta sauce was ...ok/meh  although not 5 stars.  Minimally salted. 

Meatball pasta, again - minimal salt, sauce ok, meatballs ok/meh...

Cappuccino was a friggin insult to coffee !!! Tasted like - watered down- DRIP coffee !!! O-M-G.  Probably their machine broke down and spewed unpressurized waster thru the coffee grounds!!

Extraordinaria comida! Y la atención de Mario fue espectacular Los platillos exquisitos y el CHILE q nos ofreció muy bueno, un ambiente agradable gozamos de una música lado muchas gracias volveremos pronto

Stumbled across this place while wondering through the Venetian. They had happy hour going on with select drinks and food at $6 each.  We ended up going here two days in a row for the HH.  We tried all of the five food items on the HH menu.  Our favorite was the crispy gnocchi.  Everything was actually really good, except we weren't fans of the risotto, wasn't as good as what we had in Italy.  Service was friendly but slow. It reminded us of being in Italy where they are in no rush to get you to leave.  We had to request the check each time after sitting for awhile.  We visited Vegas on a budget so this was a great find for us, we actually made it our dinner with just eating HH items.  We would go back here for sure next time we are in town.

Really great authentic pizza, enjoyable atmosphere, and quality service. What's not to like here? 

My girlfriend and I dropped by twice on our weekend trip because the pizza was that delicious, without being too heavy. Just $6 for the personal sized pizza during HH! Really great deal, and there are plenty more on the Happy Hour menu. Truly, if you're a fan of the authentic Italian pizza experience, you'd be remiss not to try this spot.

 I like the imaginary sky above when you eat "outside," and it allows you to people watch if you so choose. On the other hand, you can always eat inside, get away from the noise, and enjoy a quieter dining experience. This restaurant was just a short walk from the Baz show, so if you're heading that way, I definitely recommend it as a place to eat before you watch. It was uncrowded, and allowed us to have a good meal and get our check in rapid fashion before heading out.

Last but not least, the canals of Venice are just around the bend! So it's a perfect place for a stroll after dinner.

We decided to try this place out for lunch while at the Venetian on March 4. 
It was happy hour time we discovered... so we decided to just get a few items off of their happy hour menu and a drink and call it a day. 

Menu is very small for HO. 5 food items
5 drink selections. $6.00 each

They bring a empty can of crushed tomatoes with hard bread inside...after you order. I didn't like it. No flavor at all. 

We ordered the pepperoni  pizza, Prosciutto Mozzarella Bruschetta and a meatball Slider. 

When I checked in on the Yelp app. It said I can redeem a free Italian cocktail  
So we both checked in and saved $32.00. Since each of the drinks we got were $16.00 each. Yikes. Haha. 

Soooo. The waitress was horrible 

We never got the meatball slider after our other 2 items arrived. 
When questioned after waiting for them. 
She acted like we never even ordered it. 
Then she forgot to subtract the 2 drinks off of the bill (figures) 
She never came and asked us if everything was ok etc. 
pizza was greasy and spicy. 
I won't be back.

Whole see bass was grilled, deboned and serve. It was fantastic. Also tried the table side tiramisu, lady fingers was not soggy at all. Very yummy. Waiter, Brandon, is one of the best we met. He made our dinner very enjoyable. Thank you, Brandon.

Wonderful! We stumbled upon this while looking for a light dinner after a show at the Wynn. We had a meat & cheese platter that was perfect! The bread served before the meal is hearty & delicious. The meats & cheeses are authentic. Great atmosphere as well. I should've tried more of the food, but that was plenty!

Just had a fantastic meal here.  Delicious spaghetti alle vongole - tasty handmade pasta with mild, juicy, buttery Manila clams.  My family enjoyed the spaghetti frutti di mare and gnocchi bolognese.  Loved all our apps as well - roasted beet salad, burrata panzanella (burrata is REALLY good here!) and wood roasted octopus.  I had THE BEST melt-in-your mouth Tiramisu for desert.  I have not had tiramisu this good in the US, only in Florence, Italy!  It was also fun to watch our server prepare our heavenly desert.

Loved the ambience of "outside seating" in St. Mark's Square while listening to live opera.  Our  family really enjoyed our entire meal and overall experience.  Service was excellent as well!!! Thank you for a great evening!

Absolutely delicious. So good we went 2 days in a row. Excellent sized portions and very reasonable prices. Service was excellent. Ask for Christian, he will take care of you. I have super restrictive dietary needs and they exceeded all expectations for accommodating me. I had the halibut and my husband had the shrimp scampi and the tagliatelle with short ribs...  we will definitely be coming back next time we are in town.
Mediocre food and bad service. They just sell atmosphere. Prime Burger around the corner cost a lot less for our next dinner and it was so so much better

Had a amazing lunch here again. This is our second time here.  The service is superb and our friendly server was Brandon.  He is super helpful, friendly, and gave great suggestions on what to order.  The meal came out perfectly.  Love the hand crafted pastas and their fried calamari. The atmosphere here is very relaxing, right next to the St Mark square with all those free entertainments. We just had a lovely lunch and will definitely come back again and again.
Had a private party here last night.  Great staff, great food and large bar. I will frequent here more often

The problem with this place is the pricing. Yesterday, I ordered a nicely seasoned but not particularly special salmon filet on a bed of steamed spinach and a modest bowl of cheese ravioli in pesto sauce. No drink. $72 incl tax and 15% tip. I know this is Vegas, but c'mon! Should have been around $50 after everything. Somewhat tasty, but I have no pressing desire to go back. If you work hard for your money, better options exist so 2 stars. But if money is no object, then enjoy, you rich bastard! 4 stars. The average = 3 stars.

Las Vegas is filled with good to great restaurants and Mercato Della Pescheria falls into the later category. Located in the open Galleria of the Venetian we were entertained by a fun trio yet somehow it felt intimate.  Each dish we ordered was delish, and our waiter Claudio was the part of the puzzle that gave this a five star rating.  We rate this a Best of Vegas. Ordered the Burrata, eggplant Parmesan and the Linguine a frutti d' mara.  Yum yum yum.

I called and make a reservation for Saturday evening @9:45pm I also asked the hostess if we could please be seated inside. Once we arrived the hostess asked us to wait while she found the manager, making sure it was ok to be seated inside?  I'm not sure why this is an issue, but each time I've had to request to be seated inside, each time we are the only ones inside? I prefer being seated in a more formal setting when dressed for an event, Not patio style.  Overall the food is good, service is typically good as well.

Hopped off the plane at McCarren with a dream and my cardigan...

We checked into our hotel at the Venetian and got settled in. By the time we decided to step out for dinner- I was pretty tired and just wanted something in my stomach.

We walked down to the Grand Canal Shops to see if something would catch our eye- and we found this place. The fact that they made their pasta in house was appealing to us.

We ordered the fettuccine alfredo with chicken, and vegetable pizza.

WOW!

I'm just going to say it... the pasta was probably the best pasta I've ever had. The texture and flavor was incredible. The texture was thick, yet chewy. Pasta typically doesn't have much flavor, but this one was def different than any other I've had. The alfredo sauce was creamy and delicious. The chicken was the only part of the dish where I was like- eh ok. 

The pizza... wow. All kinds of flavors and textures going on in my mouth. It had onions, red bell pepper, zucchini, and mushroom (I believe they were shiitake, but I could be wrong?). 

I really want to come back for another pasta dish before I go home, but hello! I'm in Vegas! There are sooo many other amazing eating options... but this place was so good... we shall see!

We stopped in here for lunch recently and it was lovely.  My eggplant parmesan sandwich was delicious and service was great.  

It's always a little odd to do the "outdoor dining" in a casino but it works and you have a great view of the mini-shows.

Had a great experience here, thanks in large part to our stellar server, Robert. Cheese plate appetizer was a good start - especially the Grana Padano. Robert helped us pick out a good bottle of Italian wine. The sea bass was an especially great entree.

Place was quiet for a Friday.  Menu looked good so thought we would try it.  I had the pizza and the lady had the seafood salad.  Hers was very good.  My pizza had a slight spicy taste to it.  Crust and mozzarella were good but couldn't get past the spicy sauce to truly enjoy it,

Service was good.  Price was king of high but that is vegas.

Great place for a nice relaxing lunch. Service was fantastic. Got the lunch box, which is a starter and smaller entree for $19. The salmon carpaccio and spaghetti & meatballs were tasty. With a Yelp check in, also got a free Italian cocktail. Got the Shaggy, which was like an Italian version of Moscow mule. Drink alone  was worth $16, so great deal. Worth a visit.

My husband and I stayed at The Venetian to celebrate our 3rd Anniversary. We find that most restaurants in the Venetian are great. However, Mercato is excellent. From appetizers to main courses, everything was delicious! We were mostly impressed by the waiter, Alsonso. He was a sweetheart. The restaurant already reminded us of our wonderful experience in Italy, but Alsonso made us want to go back. Our next vacation will definitely be the place he mentioned to us where he came from. He was busy, but was always pleasant and answered all our questions. He made us feel very special and at home.  My husband wouldn't stop saying how much he liked Alsonso. We thoroughly enjoyed the restaurant atmosphere, foods, and, of course, the superior customer service. We always come back to Venetian, but now, we will always come to eat at Mercato when we are in Las Vegas.

My stars:  (5=epic "best of") (4=really tasty and want to go again and again) (3=good and will go back once in a while) (2=fair, might return for a visit if there was some glimmer of hope) (1=avoid at all costs)

Go or No? Go

Tease:  Inside the Venetian square... 

Why I went:  This fairly new restaurant looked to be a nice place for a mid-day meal

When: 11/22/16

Food:  My wife and I got here in time for their happy hour around 3pm.  My wife enjoyed a tasty Belini and I enjoyed a classic Negroni.  We shared a meat & cheese platter which was delicious and included honeycomb, crackers and grapes.  You got to choose from a variety of items including speck, salumi and all kinds of cheese.  We also split their meatballs...which were amazing.  They were super tender and flavorful.  The marina sauce included was also excellent.  We also shared an octopus appetizer that was really tasty...we had to get some kind of seafood after all!

Service:  Very good.  Our waiter was excellent.  The hostess could have been a little more friendly...but once the waiter came over, all was good!

Hints/Final thoughts:  If you're looking for a light (and they certainly have some not-so-light options too!) meal, this place really delivers some tasty items!
Great service.....thank you Ernesto! Fantastic food especially the grilled Octopus. Highly recommended!

Even though you're indoors, this place makes you kind of feel like you're sitting in Italy at an outdoor cafe. We came for lunch and had a nice charcuterie and cheese platter. There was more meat than cheese, and we fought over the cheese with a nice glass of white wine. I think this is the nicest of the several Italian places in the vicinity.

Such a great place: the vibe is amazing ! Great food and drinks! Our service was also so good! Lots of attention and overall made for a fun night! Highly recommend this place! Great to take friends out here!

We ate here with friends. I had the grilled octopus which was incredible presentation and very tasty.  The spicy large shrimp was excellent too.  Victor was our waiter and he was responsive and helpful.
Romantic ambience. Great service and food. My wife and I had a great time here. The portions are just the proper size.

This experienced happened while dining on 11/08/2016: I was told there was an urgent phone call for me, with some kind of resemblance to my name, on their business phone. What ensued was a threatening, racist demand to leave the restaurant, claiming I voted for Trump. Callers have names of Sabrina & George, stating they were the owners of the restaurant, calling from corporate. This went on for at least 20 minutes, with two people of the staff, the management, talking to whomever was on the phone. The lady who handed me the phone verified that the caller asked for a " black lady with wild hair". Note: my hair is in a chignon, and I am light skinned. I had to demand for security, which told me I am being watched, for my protection, from different cameras, until I leave the casino.  After all that, I still had to cover my check, plus the $9 Pellegrino bottle.  Needeless to say, my appetite waned to nothing. All this happened on their business phone, without no one ever verifying that it was Not the restaurant demanding I leave because I was Black and with the assumption of voting for Trump. 
This may be due to the election, so patrons of darker races may not experience this atrocious behavior, but I vehemently question the business practices of this establishment.

Food was delicious and priced well. The server was great and hospitable. They served my sister a birthday dessert with sparkler on it!!!! They all sang Happy Birthday which made it extra special for her. The ambiance was real nice with music from the square and the lighting looked as if it were daytime under the pretty sky. Two thumbs up!!

I loved this place. The ambiance feels cozy and intimate. It feels you are outdoors, helped by some soothing live music. Our server, Brandon, was a delight. His recommendations and service were spot on, and he was very attentive.

We ordered the Chicken Alfredo and Swiss Chard Ravioli, with a side of foraged mushrooms. All three were delicious. 

To top it all, we had the tiramisu, which is the best tiramisu I've had. It's a little different from the others I've had and he mixed it right in front of us.

I came to check out this new Resturant. Awesome experience. Mirko the manager was very nice and had us seated quickly and Davide was so knowledgable and actually very funny. Awesome place excellent food!

Wow place in Venetian. They make own noodles! My ceviche was excellent.
Truly the best seafood and pasta place in Vegas.

Stopped here cause i was ssuper hungry after gambling and  walking aroundfor a while!

Ordered a glass of wine and the gnocci pasta in red sauce!

It was really really really not good! Thats why the two stars.

Didnt eat anything else...so well..too many better places in vegas to eat!

Food and service are good for a high tourist traffic spot in a Las Vegas hotel.
I highly recommend the tiramisu which is absolutely delicious, it is made fresh at your table.
Good pasta & seafood, but a little hard to find. Located UPSTAIRS-in St. Mark's Square.

Sooo disappointed. Everyone said the food in Vegas is incredible. Found this place, along with another, just not up to snuff. The "amazingly awesome" chicken parmigiana was something that tasted like it wasn't heated up long enough in the microwave. It wasn't hot, and barely luke warm. The pasta was "homemade", but I found the tomato sauce mixed in with it lacking of flavor and spices. I am wondering if the real chef called in sick when we were there!?

I also unfortunately spent some time in the bathroom afterwards since I really ended up not feeling intestine-wise very well after the meal.

On the positive side, I really enjoyed the environment (inside the Venetian where it was "covered" with a fake sky). It was very casual and relaxing. The service was decent.

I am really, really glad I didn't go with my original seafood thoughts since if they can't get chicken right imagine if I had their seafood. Yikes!

Italian dining down in the canal shoppes of the Venetian hotel.  

Wonderful "open" air venue.  Keep in mind that this is an indoor shopping mall. 

We were there for lunch and had a great time with family.   Great suggestions from the waiter.  

It's Vegas at the Venetian so prices are a bit more.  But overall a good time and great food.

My husband and I recently spent a weekend in Las Vegas and chose to dine here for lunch one afternoon. We each ordered an entree and shared the Snapper Ceviche as an appetizer. Hours later we both fell ill with food poisoning, with the only shared food all day being the appetizer at this restaurant. Needless to say, when I am in Las Vegas again I will not be dining at this establishment with poor controls around food quality. Thank you for ruining our weekend away.
Excellent service, fresh pasta and great fresh seafood.  Had a wonderful experience while on a conference.

The place is for tourists only, and the tourists who haven't traveled a lot. My mother and I are locals, visited the place before a show, the restaurant is ok, food ok, very bland, service good, a fake Italian food court. You can't do fast paced "restaurant" , in a venue that represents itself as fine dining.

Came here for a Vegas work trip. We wanted a nice place to eat but would still be within range for budget so we came across this. Located inside Caesar's...it's a great little view of the canals and nice painted skies and musical performers...just overall great ambiance. 

We did the Yelp check in offer to get a free cocktail. I don't think our waiter really knew what was allowed so he told us anything on the menu is fine. Score!!

I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs dish and it was delicious. I always am hesitant to order that because it's so basic and I definitely don't like it to taste basic like I made it myself with a jar at home. It definitely didn't! Super tasty sauce, gigantic meatballs that were also well flavored, portions are big. Overall I would recommend it. 

We also ordered the burrata and tomato dish to share as appetizer and the cheese was just so good!

We absolutely love, love, and love this place! I couldn't stop talking about how delicious their scallops were! It was three fat pieces with the perfect amount of scorch! I believe it was around $37 for the dish, but it was well worth it! I also ordered a side of potatoes and it doesn't look very tasty when it first comes out, but it was perfect as well! Oh, and the oysters! They were so fresh and delicious! Just thinking about it makes me want to eat some more. My husband ordered the mamas lasagna. He said it was very good and the serving size was humongous! He only ate half! Not to mention the service was great as well! I can't wait to go back and try other dishes!!

Delightful! ... hand made pasta and slow cooked sauce is delicious! We were skeptical at first because there was so many restaurants to choose from but the presentation and the ambience was a huge factor. Alongside side the terrace we had violin players. 
Our host Mario was very knowledgeable and made the experience more delightful. I had the seafood scampi with fresh made pasta and my husband had the seafood risotto. The food was fresh and high quality! Will definitely come back!
Tip.. order the seafood with clams with fresh pasta and extra sauce and make it spicy it's delicious!!
Food was great, service was excellent. Our server Brandon extremely kind and attentive!
Great menu, excellent taste & quality, outstanding service. Claudio was extremely knowledgeable, professional and charismatic. Thank you for the unforgettable experience! Will be back.

Very friendly service. The low rating is for the food. We got panini for lunch here and they were very greasy and unhealthy. My salmon panino was made with crumbled pieces of room temperature salmon for $17.  I don't know why they can't just grill a fresh piece of salmon for this sandwich.  They advertise their restaurant as a fresh seafood market restaurant, so they really shouldn't serve cheap seafood.  We wish we had gone to Otto instead for excellent pasta.

Food and ambience here are amazing. Their lunchbox option is such a steal. I honestly think they can get away with charging more, but I will not complain. My favorite things were the calamari and tableside tiramisu. The fried calamari is not your ordinary, every other restaurant kind. The crispiness and batter, along with the amazing Aioli sauce are just on another level. Will come back to try other things

This place is a hidden gem in the heart of Las Vegas. We've been coming to Vegas for years during the holiday season and we've spent countless hours waiting in line for the newest popular buffet or the latest celebrity chef's hit restaurant. But after a while the wait just takes a toll on you and all you crave is a simple yet fulfilling dining experience.
And that's exactly what we found in Mercato Della Pescheria. Being seafood lovers and having visited many seafood restaurants around California, we didn't have high expectations when it came to the quality of seafood in Vegas (since it's in the middle of the desert). We ordered the whole branzino and the jumbo grilled shrimp and we were absolutely pleasantly surprised! The shrimp was huge! I'm not kidding. Each shrimp was bigger than my entire hand!! Probably the biggest I've ever seen. The whole fish was cooked to perfection, and the service was excellent. Our waiter Ernesto was very attentive, polite, helpful and welcoming. He offered to take pictures of us, kept checking if we needed anything, and volunteered to ask the kitchen any questions he had .. all while keeping a friendly smile. Overall, we enjoyed a memorable meal in a nice and relaxing ambiance with beautiful live entertainment right next door. Would highly recommend this place, and can't wait to come back again next year!
Great food and the Robert was tending bar and was awesome. Attentive service, great cocktails, good company. We'd highly recommend and we'll be back soon!

Adelle was our waitress and she not only attended to our every need but went above and beyond throughout our entire dining experience.  We never had to wait for our drinks to be replenished, she checked in regularly to make sure our dining experience was exquisite!  Indeed it was and I will be returning because of Adelle's attentiveness!  Super impressed! And the food was delicious as well! Good good!

I had a very good lunch with a sea bass and cauliflower puree. Francisco was our waiter and he was very professional and friendly. 
Great place for lunch while at the Venitian.

You pay for the atmosphere here, essentially sitting in the Venetian's St. Marks square.  It's fun to see the crowds and listen to the performances.  The food was average, shared the calamari to start .. our group had the gnocchi, eggplant Parmesan, and shrimp scampi.. best to worst in that order, starting with decent to bland.  Won't be coming back.

Absolutely AMAZING service! The food 5 's. The atmosphere, with live entertainment playing off into the distance exquisite. The painted blue sky up above soothing. Who knew in my home town of beautiful Las Vegas,  this glorious dinning experince is at our finger tips. Go hungry... there is so much to tickle you taste buds. 
See you again soon

Sweet spot! Nobody at the bar but Jesus was quick to greet us. I like when a bartender shows the happy hour options. 

Beefeater tonic for $6 in Vegas is a steal. Apps for $6 3-7 steal. Greeted by 3 friendly faces on the way in so it most certainly made us want to stay. Bonus to us we checked in and got a free cocktail. Bam another reason to make this our dinner spot tonight.

Best Italian food at the Venetian hotel, Las Vegas!
Highly recommend their Ravioli with pesto cream sauce and their vegetable pizza. Both soo fresh and tasted amazing! Will definitely come back.

*Price: reasonable for LV, especially with their happy hour deal, $6 drinks and small plates. 4 star.
* Atmosphere: casual. There is dining area with fine dining setting and sasual patio area. It is a great place to dine and watch the free shoes in St. marks square. It has an outdoor feeling effects from the ceiling, shoppers. 4 star.
* location: grand canal shopping of the Venetian. 4 star.
* Meals: fresh. Delicious. Their breads come before meals are so fresh and moist! Good portion for sharing. 4 star.
* service: friendly. Our food is coming out at good pace. 4 star.

Walked by this place while looking for a place to eat in between lunch and dinner time. The menu and location captured our interest. Since most other Italian restaurants are not opened for dinner until 5 pm, we decided to try this place even though there are some not-so-good yelp reviews. To our surprise, this place is pretty good! 
The Happy hour menu is definite a good deal for drinks and small plates. We got pizza and prosciutto mozzarella bruschetta for $6 each.
The pizza is very simple with thin crust , cheese and pepperoni but fresh made and tasty. The bruchetta is very tasty with thin slide prosciutto over mozzarella and their freshly made delicious bread topped with olive oil and fresh herbs. It is probably the best bruschetta I have had so far.

We also ordered hamachi crudo and spaghetti with meat balls from the regular menu.
Hamachi crudo, $19: fresh thin slide hamachi served with tomamato sauce, and herbs. It is very fresh and delicious.
Spaghetti with meatballs, $19: good size to share. Simple traditional dishes but tasty.

Overall, it was a delicious meal with very reasonable price. It is so much fun to watch the show in the square while dining! We definitely will come back.

So my friends and i stumbled across this place walking thru the Venetian. The food here is awesome. We had the Calamari and Bruschetta and it was super fresh which I didn't expect. Then we shared the mushroom risotto and the gnocchi not a disappointment.  So glad we found this place, I just had to share.

Came here to celebrate a friends bachelorette . Beautiful environment. It did indeed feel like we were at the St.Marks square. Wonderful staff. Everyone was kind, from the wait staff to the manger himself. Solid food- had the salmon, Cobb salad, pesto chicken pasta and prosecco. But above all, superior company
Fabulous food!  Intimate seating inside but it is nice to sit outside in st mark square.
Great service and great food!The happy hour is specially amazing! We had such a good time here!

Hello, and thank you all for being here today. I am here to announce that this is my first actual yelp review... however, scrolling through yelp is one of my favorite hobbies. I can get lost in the sauce. 
Although I work at a bar downstairs, this was my first visit to Mercato. I have been in the service industry for 5+ years and even though I think of myself as an easy guest to please, customer service goes a long way. I was lucky enough to belly up to the bar and be served by Andrew. I really hope I'm getting his name right he only said it about  7 times. He's from Chicago. He is impeccable beyond belief. I truly have never had such amazing guest service. Ask for him. Be blown away. We ordered octopus for an appetizer. And our entrees were ravioli and fettuccine. All three made with super fresh ingredients and the flavor was on point. Table side tiramisu. Whipped up in front of your face. 
You are welcome. Go enjoy. Ps- thank you Andrew, you are a star at your craft. 
Blessins.

We found this restaurant as we entered the grand canal shoppes. It was my cousin's birthday, and we were actually headed to another restaurant. But once I saw their menu and great location. We had to try it out and I am SO glad we did. First off let me begin, what really made our meal fabulous is the manager, Mirko. I knew it was her when she walked up because she was so warm and welcoming. We ordered the seafood platter that is designed to be shared with several people so we went with that. We also ordered mussels (one of my faves), argula salad, fresh pasta. And Mirko decided to make us table side fresh dessert, which was such a nice touch for the birthday girl. I will be honest. Before Mirko came over, our service was very slow and the waiter wasn't very attentive. But once I told Mirko that we had a birthday, everything changed. I am glad we got to meet the manager. I forgot the server's name but maybe it was his "off" days...
Over priced and service was crazy the server was annoying and didn't listen and try to be salesmen and added to our food without asking us

Mercato Della Pescheria is an Italian Seafood Restaurant located in the Venetian Casino Hotel by the Canal Shops. They prepare some of the food they serve with coal smoke that is unique for a different taste. Most of the seating is on a big what looks like an outside patio. That sits in front of an Italian Market with ancient looking Italian Buildings behind. On my visit near to the patio were people singing in Italian, a stilt walker and a person pretending to be a statue. It was kind of like a mini circus.

I think what I enjoyed the most (food wise) was the amazing hot crusty flavorful bread they served. It was the best Italian Bread I tasted in many years. I sure could go for more right now.

We ordered and the food came out very rapidly.

We started with the Swiss Chard Ravioli. They were quite good and also house made. Pasta might be the sweet spot here.

For dinner I tried the Coal Smoked Sea Bass. It was a very large portion of fish that had all the middle bones removed. It had a slight coal smoked taste. I thought the fish was prepared reasonably well but did run slightly dry. My plate also came with saffron laced cauliflower puree,  some cauliflower and fennel arugula salad.

My husband tried the Veal Osso Bucco. His plate was good but not perfect. The risotto was ran dry and was slightly crunchy and the meat was flavored nice but also was a little underdone in a few parts. 

OK -Bread is great! Pasta is very good,  Proteins not perfect.

3.5
We had a great meal tonight. Our server Brandon K was fantastic. Very helpful and courteous. His suggestions were very good and helpful. He really knew the menu and was very engaging.

Walking thru the Venetian we were charmed by the host and hostess as well as the ambiance.  A lovely meal with beautiful scenery and great people watching.    Super pleasant wait staff and delicious food!

Very good location in Venezia Hotel
Quite popular and needs reservation
Pasta very good
Wide selection of wines

We had heard great things about Mercato and were very excited to go there for dinner.  We started off on the wrong foot with the hostess.  She made too much of a deal of us wanting to eat in the covered part of the restaurant away from the outdoor plaza seating.  We were just about to walk away when she miraculously found us a table.

Once we were seated, we had a fabulous experience.  We worked with Manu.  He was charming and was very helpful with drink and entree selections.  We started off with the Grilled Octopus.  Very tender and complemented nicely with our bread and wine.  For our entrees we had the Linguini Futta Di Mari and the Swiss Chard Ravioli.  The pasta was very fresh and flavorful.  

We finished off our amazing meal with the Torta Al Cocciolato.  The piece was huge, but it was so delicious we had not guilt.

Had an enjoyable dinner with my girlfriends here with top service. It feels more like a "homey" Italian place than the other Italian places I've tried in Vegas, presenting more care for their customers and for their food.

Service was the star, but the food was very good. The seafood pasta and lasagna were great choices. The sea bass could have used a little more flavor. Very good caesar salad. Cocktails were well prepared. Ambiance is a plus, with lots of great people watching in the courtyard type area.  

Recommend!
We enjoyed our meal here!  Food a hard  10, service a hard 10,   ambience inside a hard 10.  We had tuna and  seafood risotto that were delicious!
Great service and food!!  Nico, our waiter was very friendly and helpful.   The pesto pasta and pizza was tasty.  The tiramisu was amazing!
The location really good and the food was great! Enjoyed the service and all around good ambiance. Would recommend the mushroom risotto.

Came to Mercato Della Pescheria for the first time this weekend with a group of seven people during happy hour. If you are not into seafood, you probably won't like the happy hour menu. However, the martinis are great! I had the pear martini it was smooth and refreshing. 
To eat we ordered a few different appetizers that were $7 each. Bread was complimentary and was so fresh it was still hot when we got it to the table. Bruschetta was tasty; tomatoes were nice and soft full of flavor. The Caesar salad was $14 and not worth the price very small. Calamari was delicious and served with a sweet sauce. The crochets were great as well. 
The restaurant has a beautiful location where you can watch the performance straight from your table. Serving sizes are small, I don't recommend coming here if you're hungry. Just looking for a snack then this is the place to come. 
The service here was great, very formal and respectful.

Very disappointing restaurant with rude attitude. Walked in and ordered the food right away and it's been 45 min that we are waiting but we haven't got our complimentary bread yet and our waiter is not around!
Seriously, this is how you welcome your customers!
Zero customer service from Matthew!

Excellent food and service.  Two hostess girls were super nice and friendly. The server was great too.  We had 2 pizzas - pepperoni was perfect thin sliced from wood oven. Great drinks too with the lemoncello. We will be back!

Had a really good experience dining here! My family and I wanted to sit outside to watch the performances and the seating provided was perfect for that. It was interesting how the complimentary bread came in cans and the breadsticks were simple and tasty. We ordered calamari and bruschetta. The calamari was really good, the bruschetta was alright. It wasn't quite what we had expected but was flavorful. For our main dishes, we ordered prosciutto pizza and shrimp penne pasta. Both were delicious and nicely made. The dishes weren't too heavy and it was quite enjoyable dining here along with the entertainment so close-by.
Excellent food! Ricardo was our server and did a fabulous job of service! Making sure my wine was right. Ended the meal with tableside tiramisu! Fabulous!
Excellent all around, Devon was a pleasure to work with and made a special night happen for my dads 94th bday.

I had my birthday lunch here and it was great . Found it by accident in the Venetian hotel . No reservations but we got seated right away.
Ordered a Burrata, Tomato Salad and my friend had a slightly seared tuna salad . Both were very nice.
Good wine selection too. 
For dessert we ordered Tiramisu which had a strange preparation. Lady fingers at the bottom of the bowl , then the waiter poured espresso / cream over and finished it with grated dark chocolate . It tasted delicious !
They also brought a lemon cheesecake with whipped  cream on the side. It was wonderful and so fresh. They will sing for you, if you want and wear Venetian masks . I declined though .
Capuchino was very good and strong. Our waiter Brian was delightful , observant and fast ,very personable .
Fun lunch !!
This place is a must be in Vegas I just love it 1st the San Marcos sq then the service and last and no less the food absolutely delicious

Excellent meal!! Our server Lino was beyond excellent. Guided us on what to order and let me know I was ordering too much which I appreciate. I typically do and don't finish anything. Everything was excellent and service was exceptional. This is my second time here and will continue to return when in Vegas.

Disappointing. Went in for lunch looking for a tasty bit of fish after too many group meals during during the conference this week.  After being seated we were given the dinner menu.  I asked for the lunch menu which I seen online but was told the lunch menu is not available this week.  With the HIMMS conference in the Venetian this week, I guess they thought why not take advantage of all the expense account clients. I probably should have just left at that point.   
My wife had the Caesar salad which was much smaller and not nearly as tasty as the one in the Grand Luxe Cafe.  I had the charred tuna steak which turned out to be one of the weirdest fish dishes I have ever been served.  It was blackened with something that tasted like instant coffee and served on what was advertised as a red wine reduction but was a really dark sauce that might have been ok for short ribs, but way inappropriate for tuna.  The blackening and sauce overpowered any taste of the tuna.  

Otherwise service was fair for a busy convention lunch time.  Ten buck for bottle of Pellegrino and sixty two buck for a middling Pinot Grigio seemed par for the experience.
They are horrible at everything from seating to healing order. They did come to take order for 40 minutes even after calling multiple times.

My boyfriend brought me here for a birthday dinner and it was literally the best food ever! Our server was on point we ordered a cheese and meat tray (I don't eat meat but I had to try the prosciutto omg so amazing). We shared the seafood risotto and another pasta with a huge lobster tail in it ( can't remember the exact name) I can't wait to go to Vegas again this place was really so authentic
Best Burrata tomato you will find, a lot of flavor, great idea to have a slice of toasted bread under, perfect combination !!!!!

Great happy hour drinks, apps, and pricing to match.  Be sure to check in to receive a free beverage! 

Jesus was our bartender and made sure we were taken care of.  We will be back!

Don't even waste your time eating in this restaurant. The service is slow, and poor. Ordered our food, shrimp scampi and chicken parmesan. Waiter said he'd bring us bread, and 20 minutes later our food came, and still no bread. Shrimp scampi was with penne pasta, and dry. Shrimp was very over cooked. Chicken parm was nothing special at all, and the food at Olive Garden is 100X better. We received our check, and the waiter brought our bread after we were finished and claimed it had, "just come out of the oven," and it was cold. Would NEVER eat there again, and we wanted to leave and eat at the Italian restaurant across the way. The food was just awful and completely over priced. Awful experience and completely disappointed.

Excellent food and service. An amazing and tender fillet mignon and pasta, perfect seafood, pizza, salads and appetizers. 
Tasteful drinks and wine. A must-go restaurant when wandering in the Strip.
Our waiter was one of a kind. Mario espectacular service.

Belated review, dinner on 8/1/2017

The one thing this restaurant has is ambiance... sitting on a patio in St. Marks Square! That was the memorable part, along with the cool tomato cans on the table with bread. The rest... okay but not memorable. An Italian menu (no kidding huh?) and we focused on pasta for supper - spaghetti and meatball, carbonara, spaghetti with clam, and Swiss ravioli. None were bad but my carbonara seemed to have sat under heat lamps a bit longer than I would have preferred. Desserts were good - cheesecake and chocolate torta. Only item I can honestly say was distasteful was the espresso martini. The foam was thicker than I've ever seen in an espresso martini and whatever they used to make the foam left the drink tasting soapy. But the negroni was good so if there is another visit I'll certainly opt for that.

We had a group dining event in the private wine room that was fantastic. Everything about the restaurant is extremely authentic from the food to ambience, you feel as though you are transported right to Italy. The service was stellar, the servers were extremely attentive. We can't wait to come back and book our next event!

Authentic Italian food!!!
My favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas.
The pasta is fresh made on premises daily.
The desserts are incredible, tableside Tiramisu!
The staff is welcoming and professional.
Dine on the patio and feel like you are in Venice, Italy.
I owned several restaurants in my day and 
have nothing but respect for these operators.
Keep up the good work.

3.5 stars.

My daughter and I had "happy hour" snack at 3PM as we had a late dinner scheduled.

We had oysters, a mini pepperoni pizza and the grilled octopus.  Every item was $6 which seemed like a good deal.

The pizza was very good.  The pepperoni had a spicy kick on a thin crust.  The size was bigger than I thought it would be given the price.

The grilled octopus had very good flavor.  Portion was pretty small but makes sense given the pricing.  However, the meat was mostly the body part (not tentacles) which made me think they save the better parts for the full-priced menu (which is a bit of a pet peeve of mine.  If you're going to have happy hour, don't have the food be 2nd class citizens on the menu).  But maybe the regular order is the same, who knows.  The octopus was on a bed of mashed potato which I thought was an odd pairing.

The oysters were a bit sad.  First, you get 2 for $6 which seems like pretty regular pricing, even for a nice restaurant.  This is the happy hour deal???  How much they they regularly cost?  The weren't very good oysters either and the accompaniments (cocktail and vinaigrette) were not very good as well.

All in all, not bad.  The setting is cool as you get to sit in the patio area of Palazzo/Venetian's St. Mark's Square.

Atmosphere is good but, that's about all.  

The food:  I had seared tuna salad. The salad was fine (pretty hard to mess up lettuce). The tuna appeared as if they took a torch to the outside.  It was literally BLACK and crumbling. The inside was close to what you would expect for seared tuna. It was even a decent piece of fish.  But, I cook better on my gas BBQ when blindfolded.  The bread is only ok, nothing great.  

Service:  started out fine but when I commented about the fish she couldn't get away from me fast enough. I think the tile floor has skid marks on it from her acceleration. Questioning the food was so disdained that they never came back until I was done and ready for the bill.  Not even to refill my tiny ($6.00) glass of iced tea.  

For the prices I expect better and can get better 25 feet away. I won't be back and you should spare yourself as well.

I had the Lobster Fettuccine for my meal and it was pretty good. The lobster was a bit tiny, but was cooked perfectly. We had a fantastic young server who was very attentive to our large table. The downsides are, they bring a bottle of water with no ice to your table, so ask for ice. The wine has minimal options by the glass, they want you to buy the bottle. It gets busy when conventions are in town, which is nearly always. The food can take some time to get out and you should plan accordingly.

Wow they really know how to take care of customers here.  The manager Tonya was very nice to me. The manager is extremely courteous and cordial the waitress was lovely I think her name is Savannah she was a delight to work with  they just have a good ear for service and they're wonderful people I was very happy.  Their food was delicious and I don't know what you can say about the location it was just amazing
Shit food. Do not get Mamas Lasagna absolutely terrible. I would rather eat dog food than this shit.

Excellent food , excellent ambience and an excellent host - Mirko and a waiter.

Nothing more can be asked at this restaurant. I highly recommend everybody to try this place. Specifically, we requested for vegetarian dishes and it was up to the mark.

Gnocchi - Totally KNOCKED OUT everything

I was walking by the Canal Grande at the Venetian. Great atmosphere. The Casino is one of the most beautiful I've seen in Vegas so far. We were a little bit undecided about dinner. We looked at the menu outside and my wife said she wanted to try their sautéed mussel and clams. Hostess sat us closed to the entrance so I asked if it was possible to have a table further in and the hostess gladly accommodated. After a couple of minutes we were greeted by our server who told us about their special risotto but didn't tell us his name. He gave us some water and then we placed our drink order, I ordered a Peroni beer and my wife ordered a Limoncello drop. From that moment we haven't seen our server anymore. We have been waiting very long for our drinks that never came out. Meanwhile we saw him taking care of other tables. No bread was offered to us. When we finally decided to get up and leave we met our server who was bringing only my drink and said something about the bartender being out of limoncello for my wife's drink. He could have told us before so that we could choose something else. I told him that I wanted to pay for the beer I ordered but he said that it was fine. No apologies.
