On our way out nobody greeted us or asked us why we were leaving. No manager on the floor to make sure that good customer service was provided to guests. It is a shame that a place like this is located in such a beautiful and famous establishment like the Venetian.

The staff and service here was really pleasant. Everyone from the hostess, manager, server, runners were great and took the time to talk.  The floor manager checked in on us multiple times and made sure everything was running smoothly. Our server was Manny, and he recommended the proscuitto pizza, which spot on.

My wife had the lasagna, which she felt was too heavy for her.  Our daughter had the fettucine Alfredo and it was legit. The pasta was freshly made and it was creamy without the heavy sauce.

I'm pleasantly surprised by this place. It won't be a hidden gem for too long. Usually Vegas restaurants are all flash and no substance. But I can say everything we tried was as I would expect if I was on vacation in italy.

I've been there w my girlfriend for dinner .The manager Mirco was super cool and helpuful ; he suggest to start with a couple of Italian drinks,my girlfriend had an aperol spritz and that one was delicious ... then we ordered the main courses.We are italian and the pasta home made was amazing pretty authentic ! The service was fantastic,for a while i thought to be in Italy...we ll definitly be back to try the pizza! Grazie Mirco
Came here for a bachelorette trip, and the staff are super kind and attentive. Definitely teleports you to a different place, in the best kind of way.

This place was out of this world! Our last day in Vegas we came here during happy hour. It was a quiet 3pm Sunday crowd. We were 1 of only 2 tables that chose to sit inside where we could have a bit of privacy. Our server was inexperienced but sweet. I think he would forget about us, he forgot to give us bread, and rarely came by- but we did choose to sit far from the rest of his tables. The appetizers were indulgent (I have never seen a larger serving of olives in my life) The oysters were excellent and my husband LOVED his chicken parm. My seared ahi salad was fresh and fabulous with crunchy pistachios and creamy dressing. The true icing on the cake was watching them make the "icing on the cake" We had the tiramisu, and they make it table side! If you want some wonderful Italian and charming atmosphere, you can't go wrong with Mercato!

Had an excellent experience tonight eating in St Marks square. I felt like I was back in a piazza in Italy! As a party of 3 we ordered the mussels, a caesar salad, the osso buco, the sea bass, and the halibut. Our server was Lino. From beginning to end, his service was fantastic. Lino gave me wine recommendations that were perfect to go with my meal. The food was warm arriving to the table. The mussels were very large and tasty. My boyfriend thought the osso buco was tender and flavorful, and the best he's had in a while. We loved the romaine & kale combo in the caesar. Both fish entrees were perfectly cooked, and tender. Though the prices were steep, we had a great meal, great service, and a great atmosphere to enjoy it in. As new residents to the area, we would recommend this to our guests when they come to visit in town.

Calamari was my fav.,  5 stars on authentic.  The fruite de mare pasta and halibut was v good- the homemade pasta was the best part.  Halibut out was overcooked so a tad dry for me.  Blue points were icy cold and fresh.  Service was v good, and food was delivered timely.  Good experience and meal.

My boyfriend and I went to piazza San Marco for dinner and we came across a new restaurant Mercato Della Pescheria. They accommodated us very well and our waiter Davide was amazing. He explained the menu to us and gave us excellent recommendations on the sea food. We'll definitely be back.

I love, love this place. We went an extra time since we got delayed in Las Vegas. Pasta definitely made there and fresh!  Osso bucco was way bigger than I expected!  It was so tender and delicious. Oysters were fresh. Squid Risotto was so good. Star for me was the tiramisu made at the table. It was not your typical tiramisu. So fresh and creamy and yummy!  Wish I had it on our first night!  Love the service. Prices were really not bad for Las Vegas and for the the portions. I was pleasantly surprised. A definite go to!!

I came with my friend to Las Vegas for edc weekend and we were staying at the Venetian hotel, this restaurant was conveniently located right next to the hotel so decided to get the lunch set- I got the salmon carpaccio and the coal roasted chicken, which was really tender. I loved the interior decor of the restaurant, the price reasonable and the portion was perfect size for us. Our waiter, Brandon, was very personable and gave us tips for Las Vegas! Would def return next time I'm here
We enjoyed a wonderful dinner here. Nice Manager accommodated us. Also we had Ray and Victor as our server. We will come here again. Great experience!

Came here with couple friends during thanksgiving weekend and this place was packed during dinner hours! But we were lucky enough to drop by early and make reservations. 

Food: 
-Wild Mushroom Risotto: pretty good, if you are a mushroom lover like me, you will definitely love it! 
-Friend Calamari:  YUM! This place is specialized in seafood and the calamari served with friend potato chips was so yummy!

Service and Ambiance: 
Friendly service, our waitress was very nice and helpful. The place is located in St. Mark's square, so it's pretty cute! 

Overall: four stars because I feel like the food was only decent, not mind blowing lol 
Will I come again? Hm maybe! If I have a chance! But there are too many restaurants in Vegas I wanna try haha

Was in Vegas for a girls trip and we stumbled upon this gem! By far the best food I've had in Vegas! Love the ambiance of feeling you are outdoors and let's talk about the food! From the bruschetta, clams and mussels, wild mushroom risotto, and carbonara none of it disappointed. By far some of the best pasta I've ever tasted! Service was superb and the manager was very friendly. To top it off we hardly had to wait! If and when I'm back this will be my go to restaurant! Make sure to visit this restaurant. You won't regret it!

I'm very sad to see that many people had poor service at this location, based on previous reviews. My experiences were more than stellar both times I came here for happy hour. I was looking for an inexpensive location to have some snacks and drinks, and this was perfect. The happy hour lasted until 7pm, unlike most of the other restaurants in Venetian and Palazzo which end at 6pm. 

I tried the Cosmo Bianca, Negroni, Limoncello cocktail, and pepperoni pizza. I did not know that the Negroni is a super bitter drink, so I did not like it and passed it along to my boyfriend who is used to bitter drinks (IPAs). The Limoncello was exceptional and strong, giving me a slight buzz. The Cosmo Bianca is a regular cosmo but with peach puree instead of cranberry; unfortunately it was a bit too sweet for me, and I squeezed a few lemons in it and it tasted really delicious. 

The reason why I am giving this place five stars is because of the pizza. Wow, I was so blown away that I'm pretty sure my boyfriend was sick of hearing me rave about the pizza. I've been to Italy multiple times, and every time I end up eating my weight in pizza because Italian style pizza is just divine: thin, soft but slightly chewy crust, thin but flavorful layer of sauce, and perfectly creamy mozzarella. This place had the perfect Italian style pizza outside of Italy, I was so shocked by the flavors and the texture of the pizza that I insisted we come back the following day. Also, the pizza was only $6 for a personal sized pizza! Comparable to the 5 euro pizzas I had back in Italy. I was so happy to find this place, and I will insist on going back every time I am in Vegas. Maybe I'll even try the seafood at some point... Likely not. Best pizza ever.

One of the worst restaurant experiences I have ever had. First off we asked for happy hour which our waitress (Manola) told us that we did have the happy hour menu; which we later found out was only available in the bar, which she easily could have explained instead of lying. After that the service was horrendous, she only visited the table twice in 25 min. Once she found out we were having a snack she turned extremely rude and didn't visit anymore. So we paid $30 for an appetizer with no service. It could've just been my experience with this waitress but based off of my one time I highly do not recommend.

Probably the best meal we had in Vegas this time around - every bite of every dish was delicious.  Went during Happy Hour where the appetizers and drinks were $6 and was expecting very small portions but that wasn't the case - large portions, great food, reasonable prices and an incredible location.  Will be our first stop next time in Vegas

Happy birthday to me! Before I left New York, I swore to everyone that I would not go to one of the insanely overpriced restaurants in Las Vegas. Changed my mind. It's my birthday.

Could not tear my husband away from the gondolas in the Venetian. And I was in love with the live music in the fake Saint Marks Square.

So I decided, since it's my birthday, I'm going to have a spectacular dinner. My husband, "the boyfriend who always says yes," was happy to be dining in this particular venue. The prices were stratospherically high, but the experience was worth it. The preparation was authentically Italian, and I mean real Italian, not American Italian. The fish was fresh and perfect and the wine was excellent. The entire staff was professional and welcoming and accommodating.

Instead of going to a restaurant with some famous chef's name on the door, try this restaurant instead for an amazing Las Vegas experience. Be sure to ask for a table right near the live musical performers. The entire atmosphere is magical.
Genuinely great service each time we've been here, paired with delightful drinks and great food.  The octopus appetizer is particularly recommendable.

Continue to be underwhelmed by my food tour in Vegas. This place is fairly new and we brought a large group for lunch. Hostess couldn't have been more accommodating finding a way to squeeze in a table of 12 for lunch without a reservation. Awesome to that point. 

Service was solid but the food was bad. Only taking about my meal which was the lasagna. It was completely burnt. The bottom was actually black and baked into the dish, it was really bad. 

Lasagna is pretty simple. Don't expect perfect but this looked and tasted like something that should never have left the kitchen. Poor quality control.

Whenever we travel to Las Vegas, we seem to always stop by Wolfgang Puck's on St. Mark's Square at the Venetian. We were surprised that it has been replaced by Mercato Della Pescheria. The other nearby choices had a wait for "outside" seating but this one could take us right away. I ordered 1 appetizer and a bottle of California Pinot Noir for our party. We had to ask the waiter several more times about the wine and Calamari and he kept assuring us that they were coming. When he finally brought the wine, it was completely wrong (Italian wine). My wife said that's not what we ordered and he assured us that I did order this one. I asked him to change it. At last, he did but he had my wife sample it (rather than the one who actually ordered it) and finally the calamari came out. I started reading yelp reviews noting the poor service and lack-luster food. When our entrees arrived (2 shrimp scampi, 1 spaghetti with clams, & 1 buratta cheese app)  we were all disappointed. Pasta under cooked, scampi dry and flavorless (I've had MUCH better at Macy's Cellar lunch counter). Spaghetti didn't come with a little clam fork. He had to ask numerous times for water and bread that had a hard time finding a way to our table, the very first table by the entrance in a patio!  With tip $215 and dissatisfaction. Only the wine was good. Puck's was always great food and service and we miss it.

Horrible experience ever!!!  Food here is so so but service is 100 times worse. From waiters to managers tried to avoid our table. They went around greeting all the tables around except us. As we are the only Asian table in the restaurant that mades us feel totally got discrimination here...Totally ruined our night. Never come back here again. I don't think this is smart way to do business... Good luck guys! If you won't change your attitude you will go out of business soon.
I loved this restaurant. The ambiance is amazing. Service is on point. Food is out of this world!! Highly recommend the Pasta! Hand made. Delicious!

I was visiting with a group of girlfriends for a bachelorette party. We tried several different dishes, I really loved the Branzino and there was another special but I cant remember the name but it was a pasta the waiter Alfonzo recommended. Alfonzo was awesome, he was good looking :-) and had this great Italian accent. The food was absolutely amazing, I can't wait to go back again.

This is my favorite place to eat in Las Vegas thus far. The ambiance is perfect. You can sit "outdoors" in St. Mark's Square and be Serenaded by Italian singers. The food is delicious and perfectly seasoned. They offer crusty bread in an old tomato can, which gives a rustic Italian feel. My waiter, Branden, was a true delight. I'll be back tomorrow. 

I even drew a picture of my lunch.

If you're looking for an authentic Italian touristy experience in Vegas, you've got it here at the center of Venetian: overpriced, (almost below) average, nearly identical menus amongst the handful in the main "piazza" or glorified food court. The Venetian looked to have genuinely good restos downstairs (Yardbird, Sugarcane, Chica) and I wish our group had been willing to pay the extra $10 per main for the better quality. 

It took ages for us to put in our order, and even longer to get our check back at the end of dinner, even though there seemed to be staff milling about. We got the "large" seafood platter for the three of us, and it really is better suited for two people. The most unusual and unpleasant thing was that the oysters were not properly shucked from the shell, which you would fairly expect from a restaurant in a higher end hotel on the Vegas strip. A salad is small, and the tuna looked and tasted poorly seared. I was grateful for the convenience and immediate seating. Some menu items looked better than others - particularly a raclette-styled pasta - but for a seafood restaurant, they really needed to step it up.

We had a delicious meal and a great time here!  Our server Sandra was outstanding!  She gave great food suggestions and checked on us constantly. We had the Veal Osso Bucco, Jumbo Shrimp pasta, and Maine Lobster Linguini. The birthday dessert was the highlight of the evening!  With this crazy sparkler candle, delicious cheesecake, and singing!

Top quality food.  And Mario, our server, was amazing. We felt like we were family.  The chef and staff are so passionate  about the quality of the food and the manager, Alessio, was incredibly hospitable. Old world Italian recipes with a Mesquite oven. Everything we ate was terrific.  I've eaten octopus all over the country and in many parts of the world. This octopus is truly the best.  I can't recommend this restaurant enough. We are excited about our trip back to Vegas in January, so we can come back. This will definitely be our first stop for food in Vegas.

Yum yum. The food is Italian and very tasty. The atmosphere is nice. The servers are extremely friendly, welcoming, and hardworking. They serve complimentary bread, olive oil, and vinegar. I ordered the arugula salad. While it was simple, it was very flavorful with a shrimp and lemon vinagrette. I would come back to share a salad, pasta or pizza with a friendly or some family.

Amazing service. The pesto ravioli was the best I've had. Victor and Jose M were  bothvery attentive and helpful, made me feel comfortable. Ettore, the manager was also very friendly and welcoming. Definitely a place to come in. A great Italian vibe.

Dining here ended up being a tremendously pleasant surprise.  By appearance, it is a typical casino restaurant, which is to say unauthentic looking while going over the top trying to be authentic looking.  

What makes this restaurant stand out is the amazing service I experienced.  The food was pretty good too.  But when I ordered a glass of wine, and after they asked if I liked it and my response was "eh", they swarmed me with my waiter and the manager and the wine steward.  All earnestly asked what was wrong, what my tastes were, etc.  I told them it was alright, that my expectations for wine by the glass were not high to begin with, and all was well.  But they insisted on bringing me a glass of a different wine, no charge.  I was not complaining, but they went over the top to do what they could to improve the overall experience.  I respect that a lot.  

To summarize, the atmosphere was 3.5, the food was 4.0 (but 5.0 considering it to be "production Italian", but the service was beyond 5.

So many options to choose from in the Venetian/Palazzo.  Finally narrowed our choices down to seafood and chose this.  It has a lovely setting on the square.  We didn't need a reservation at 8 pm and got a nice table.  There was live music in the square but they took a break when we got a table!  Waiter was Italian and too prompt -- we weren't in a hurry!  Didn't want a huge meal so just ordered wine and mains. We chose a half carafe of chiante for $26 (best bargain on the wine menu) and it was perfectly acceptable.  We enjoyed the complimentary bread while we waited for our dinner.  We chose shrimp scampi rigatoni with olive oil and garlic and also a whole red snapper.   The whole fish was about $42 and the pasta was about $24.  Both were excellent.  Would definitely return on our next visit.

My husband ordered red snapper and he thought it was very good. I ordered pasta and shrimp but my pasta was hard and not cooked. They immediately gave me a new plate of pasta and the second plate was al dented pasta and very good. The waiter was excellent and the service was amazing.

Had dinner here the food was excellent I was very surprised with the bill for two came to 145 bucks. I was also surprised that every five minutes someone is asking you if everything is ok. Well it wasn't   The chairs and tables are squeezed in so tight that I constantly was being bumped by the waiters and staff. After the fifth time yes fifth time I finally said something to my waiter. He asked me to point out who it was. I told him it wasn't my responsibility to keep track of who kept hitting my chair. He apologized and I continued on with dinner only to be bumped again. I finally called my waiter over again and told the guy to apologize. Needless to say dinner was ruined by the price and the nonsense of the staff. I was contacted by management after this review. They told me they were going to make this right. They asked me for my contact information. Of course they never contact me. Once again poor management.
Great service, food, and fellow diners. Great spot to unwind and enjoy the atmosphere.

Upon hearing about this restaurant, I was already expecting that it was going to be good. Upon arriving, it was better. The ambiance of the restaurant was very befitting of its cuisine type and location in the Venetian, and they have the option for guests to be seated at the outdoor (but really indoor) patio where you can view the show that appears every few minutes in the center of St. Marks Square. 

My boyfriend and I were seated quickly since we had reservations and were immediately greeted by Moises. Not to discredit the other servers at this establishment, but Moises was so enthusiastic and very engaged as a server. His recommendations were perfect and he was very patient even though we had several questions about the menu. 

We ended up ordering the Calamari and Tuna Tartare to share, while our entrees consisted of the Margherita Pizza and Seafood Risotto. I know Calamari is a pretty common dish, but something about this particular version made the batter very light yet still very crispy. The Tuna Tartare had a beautiful presentation with a great taste to match, while the Margherita Pizza was very tasty. I definitely think the Seafood Risotto was my favorite menu item out of all though, as they prepare it with a plentiful amount of seafood and the consistency of the dish is not runny at all.  

I also wanted to mention that Alessio, the manager at the time, was very warm and friendly with not just our own table but all tables that I could see. It is not always the case where the manager is able to touch each and every table, but it seemed like Alessio was on a mission to do just that. 

If I have not already said it, I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone and everyone especially if Seafood/Italian cuisine is a favorite. It never gets better than friendly service and great food, and Mercato Della Pescheria has achieved that.

Just left this place and I will not be back. I was so hungry and super excited to eat here until I got my food. Not only was it not crowded, But our food took so long to come out. And once it did I spent 15 minutes picking out chicken out of my fettuccine that I specifically asked not to be in there because I DONT eat meat. I asked to substitute the chicken for shrimp and not only was I charged $10 for 2 pieces of shrimp but they added chicken as well and by the time I was done picking it out, my food was cold and my whole pasta had a chicken after taste. I was trying to be polite and didn't want to complain but when I finally let my server know he didn't care at all and proceeded to give me my bill for $70. For a pizza and pasta I will no longer be able to eat. Which made me wish I had complained and sent it back but I didn't want to spend another 40 minutes waiting for pasta that wasn't worth it. This is the first time I haven't left a tip in my whole life. And I don't even feel regret. Save your money and time and go somewhere else.

I came here with a party of 8.  We came here instead of Picasso because we thought this place would be a better choice.  We were wrong.  Waited an hour to get our meal, only to get a cold meal.  I will not recommend this place, go somewhere else.

Service and atmosphere were wonderful!  Sea Bass was excellent, mushroom risotto magnificent.   Our server, Savanah was knowledgeable,  personable and made us feel a welcome guest.  We were presented a beautiful tirimisu compliments of Mahe for our wedding anniversary. Overall  great experience!

The best Italian restaurant in Vegas .

Mario ( super Mario) the best server I've ever had in my live .

I recommend it 100% 


Tomy

I loved the square, you get to enjoy amazing food and best shows at the Venetian. Performers get on stage couple of times a day. Incredible!!! We kept coming back to the square form Encore every day.
This place has one of the best best eggplant parms I have had. Seafood soup was great, octopus was very good.

We started off our meal with the eggplant parmesan (pictured). Their tomato sauce tastes so good! 
Then we had the chopped salad. It was a good salad, not soaked in dressing and the ingredients tasted very fresh. By the way it is a very small salad, so suitable for a starter too. 
One of the specials of the day was a mixed seafood plate (pictured) with salmon, lobster, shrimp, cauliflower and potatoes. That was delicious! Seafood tasted so fresh. They seemed simply grilled but honestly did not need anything else. The potatoes had a little pesto sauce, which paired so well. It was good to be shared since we ordered more plates, but I would recommend it for one person if they were hungry. 
Our server Nico was the best! So kind and polite. Always making sure we were enjoying our meal.
Friendly and welcoming staff. Service here is great and the food is good! Id recommended their Pepperoni Pizza at happy hour. It's only $6 and delicious!
Food and wine is good.  Our waiter disappeared several time and it was difficult to get a wine refill and the check.

After a day of sightseeing we stopped in at the Venetian and found ourselves here at Mercato Della Pescheria. Happy hour 3 to 6, friendly wait staff and bartenders, and good food. The setting is as if you are in St Mark's square but with air conditioning! A great way to end a wonderful day. Again, I can't say enough about how friendly and helpful all the staff were. You can't go wrong here.
Food is a bit pricey here but good, and the service is wonderful. The waiters are so nice, always come around to ask how u doing and I love their Italian accent! Lol I would definitely come back! :)
Had a delicious, satisfying $6.00/ order from their happy hour menu. Place to visit when you're at the Venetian.

This is our second night eating at this restaurant and everything has been impeccable.
The atmosphere is the best, service was fast and prompt without being too pushy.
Yesterday we had pizzas which were delicious.
Today we had insalata di mare which it was excellent and fresh and after I had spaghetti with clams and it was as good.

We went here on the third day the restaurant was open.  My wife ordered the pesto ravioli and I had the spaghetti fruitti de mare.  My wife loved her dish.  I felt mine was just ok.  The pasta and sauce was good but the cuttlefish was a bit tough.  I also would have swapped out half of the clams and mussels for shrimp.

That being said, the service was very friendly, the food came very fast; the overall dining experience was nice.

The food is good but not out of this world to tolerate some of the bizarre service. Service was questionable. We came in with a large group and they underwhelmed and underperformed throughout our meal.

Service was great. Nice ambiance. But the food was certainly not worth the price. It was edible but nothing to really write about. 

I would also recommend either that you drink wine or water. Even a can of lemonade, or Pepsi is $6!!!

We were interested in happy hour as we wanted to stop for a drink and light fare. They sat us and put full menus in front of us. We explained we wanted to be in the bar for a drink and appetizer.
They escorted into the bar area and there we sat without getting service at all. We asked the bartender for a menu and server, but after about 10 minutes, we were not served. Alex and team are pretty aggressive in getting you into the restaurant, but felt snubbed when we didn't want to order a full meal. Follow your gut when you go.

We dined recently in November and suggest Mercato Della Pescheria for anyone seeking to enjoy great food and people watching in the Palazzo/Venetian's St. Mark's Square! Our server Marie was from Northern Italy and made the entire experience even more special. Her menu recommendations were spot on and she shared not only some of her Italian culture but also their warm hospitality. She began by serving us a tasty board of Italian cured meats and assorted cheeses. Our entrees included traditional spaghetti and meatballs, ravioli in a pesto cream sauce, mama's lasagna, and lemon salmon. Needless to say we passed around our dishes for tasting!  Take advantage of the staff being true Italians - ask questions and for recommendations...if Marie is your server you won't be disappointed!

Shout out to our waitress Arthur, he is very knowledgeable to the menu and drinks. Very polite and friendly, we would definitely come back to see him. 
Also our food is outstanding, so many flavors. Thank you guys so much for this experience.
Heard they upped the menu. I really enjoyed my lunch here while they had mall performers in front. Entertainment and lunch with my wife what else can you ask for. Server had great customer service.

Good Italian food and friendly service. Had the chopped salad and some spaghetti with meatballs. The prices are casino high but the quality and service were good. Bartenders were very good. I dont care much for the hawking out front but they have to get their numbers.

Excellent service with Mr Mario, was our waiter and give us a high level service, Mario speaks several languages and offer a special wine and the food was great, I suggest the combination of lobster, shrimp, octopus and New York steak
Wonderful food, wonderful service, great atmosphere! Gluten-friendly too! So happy we stumbled upon this gem :)

Absolutely incredible, delicious cuisine with the "feel" of Italy and the service is beyond compare. We have told many many friends to go visit when in Vegas and we are planning a 50th bday trip here in October and this will DEFINITELY be one of our dinner spots while in town!!  Alex's service with table side presentation today was impeccable and his recommendations spot on!

Tip:  Free Italian Cocktail with Yelp Check-in!  Cocktail menu was ~$15/drink, so not a bad deal at all.  You just hafta order an entrée per person.  That's the only catch!  There's also Happy Hour from 3-6pm!

Located at the Venetian, at St. Mark's Square, this place was a pleasant surprise!

We were looking for a lunch place near the Palazzo because we wanted to go to the pool and decided on Italian.  We actually wanted a lighter option, but oh well.  

The mix of complimentary crusty bread was delicious!  We shared a Spaghetti & Meatballs and a Margherita Pizza.  Both were very good, pasta al dente.  And the portion was more than enough to share with 1 other person.

I didn't eat at that many places on the Strip, but I felt as though this wasn't one of the overprice/overrated places there!  Wouldn't mind going back.

We are locals and love coming here. There are so many restaurants to choose from on the strip, but this one is always one of our go to places.
The food is authentic and delicious. 
We were there over the weekend and we've never left a review, however this time I think it called for great positive review. 
We had excellent service from our server 'Ernesto', he was very attentive and made great suggestions. The manager always makes it point to come to your table, to make sure you're being well taken care of. 
Locals and visitors will not be disappointed. One of our fav appetizers is the eggplant yum yum :) Enjoy!

This place benefits from having an outstanding location in St. Mark's Square in the Venetian. Because I'm a sucker for authentic Italian fare, I bit, despite my better instincts. Sure enough, our dinner was quite disappointing. Antipasto was skimpy and unappealing. Branzino was not fresh, under seasoned and served with head and tail uncleaned. Shrimp was dry and way over cooked. Asparagus was a burnt mess. Waiter was nowhere to be found once food was served. Very very disappointing especially for the price. What a waste of money and of a fine dining opportunity. I later found out that this place is owned by Cubans masquerading as Italians. That's when it all made sense.

A little Pricey but wonderful!  Beef carpaccio was amazing...Nice service at the bar,  food was delicious, we had a small snafu with one of the appetizers but management quickly swooped in to rectify... love that more than anything! We are local and we appreciate the good service and lovely ingredients! Robert at the bar was outstanding! Thank you for everything!

The service at this place was below par... Waited 10 min while being seated and didn't even get acknowledged by a waiter.. only reason why I'm giving 2 stars is because the manager was very nice and she took our order due to the long wait. Ordered happy hour- brushetta and pizza.. took another 20 min to arrive. Again, no sign of the waiter for more water. I'm currently waiting for my check, it's been 5 minutes... I'll never come back here.

Best Italian food I had in the US so far!
Great food, great service and the ambience is fantastic! 
Definitely a must-dine when you're in Vegas!
Osso busco and wood roasted octopus are excellent.
Fantastic Pizza, and great service Samantha is a great bartender and gave us some terrific suggestions.  Will definitely be back.

If you want to feel yourself in Italy...you must go in this place! Alfonso and Mirko were the perfect example how Italy is and if you are looking for the best Italian experience you can't miss this place!

My friends and I had a great time at Mercato Della Pescheria during our stay in LV. Everyone from the host to the entire floor staff was very welcoming and hospitable. I also enjoyed the classical Italian music playing just outside the dining area. It added some class to the cheesy inside of the Venetian. 

We started with a Tuscany board and Caesar salad. Their cheeses and meats are legit and our server made some great recommendations. I ordered the Bucatini Carbonara and ate every last bite. The portion was on pointe and it wasn't super heavy like others I've had. It was salty, creamy, and delicious -- served with freshly shaved parm to your liking. The lasagna and bolognese looked great too, but I didn't try it.

Great restaurant!  

Ordered sea bass, Kumamoto oysters, roasted asparagus, cauliflower, calamari, and seafood risotto.

I'm not an avid risotto, so to me it was ok.  My gf who is a risotto fan said it was good!

The sea bass however, was to die for.  Ate it down to the  bones literally.  Cauliflower was roasted to perfection and oysters are fresh.  I enjoyed this place!  

Tiramisu was just ok.  It wasn't anything spectacular.  

What I loved most about this place was it gives the Eating outdoor feel without really being outdoors.  I miss you !

We showed up for the Sat evening without a reservation but of the surrounding choices, the reviews here and on other sites favored Mercato Della Pesheria. They had a table for two immediately. A great start. 

I think this is a little gem. It is easy to fall into the "Vegas trap" to get you in and out with a fake atmosphere, but not so here. It was easy to forget that we were inside a building. Our server was Italian and was very attentive, always available and his suggestions were followed and enjoyed. 

We had cocktails and starters were 1/2 dozen oysters and the cured meat platter. Very tasteful and plenty of it - with the fresh baguette in the tomato can - cute and a nice touch. I chose the seafood linguine Nd my partner the osso buccu on risotto. All too much to finish but we tried since it was great.  I tasted both dishes and some of the best I have had.

The surroundings remained busy, but not intrusive and some live music too by a trio with a guitar, an accordion and a singer which was mostly opera. Obviously there was a noise tour group here and there, but you take the good with the bad.

All in all a great evening out and we enjoyed it thoroughly. Try it. It is 4 out of 5 only since it felt a bit pricey for just two people.

This place was great! Davide was such a delightful server, and the managers really made us feel at home. Could not have had a better experience on the strip! Food was fantastic, we had pizza, risotto, and ceasar salad. Everything was really great, but make sure you get the tiramisu! Shouldn't be missed. The atmosphere was very charming (even it's "outdoor" setting was actually surprisingly relaxing).
Awesome food, superb wine, unbelievable ambience! Guaranteed five stars! Can't go wrong.
Most amazing service and divine food!  Great ambiance for friends and lovers.  One of the best restaurants in Vegas!
This place was delicious! I took my wife here for her birthday as she's a seafood nut (actually we both are) and it was terrific. Also, we checked in on here and got the free cocktails!

I have eaten at many fine dining restaurants and this was not one of them. They have people standing outside the restaurant, aggressively getting you in. That is so desperate and tacky. NOT CLASSY AT ALL. Still my husband and I went in only because an acquaintance in Las Vegas recommended. The host was really friendly. Our server who I forgot her name was a  sweetheart. The food wasn't that great. I have an Italian mother so I know real Italian food. All and all I won't be returning to this place until its upgraded.

Easily the best place in Venetian.
As we walked towards the restaurant and looked through the menu, we decided to forgo our reservation at another Italian place nearby and try this one for dinner. The ambiance convinced our gut feeling right away.

Aside from the elaborate setting and sophisticated furnishing indoor as well as patio, I was so touched by the sincere hospitality and focused attention of the wait staff.  The professionals here (I hardly use the word "professional" for wait staff, just because they are usually very part-time and "green" at so many places) pay attention to your tasting and eating progress intensely, but at a very comfortable distance.  This, tell me that people know exactly what they are doing.

Now the five-course Valentine dinner made with love:

Oyster appetizer-- fresh, elegant, just the right teaser

Grilled scallop-- seductive presentation, beautiful balance between the scallop and veggie base.  The soup/juice was a killer delicious treat.  We were handed spoons to finish it all.

Lobster risotto-- rich but not greasy, tender and flavorful... if only all the chefs in the world can do risotto right like this one...it melts in your mouth.

Filet mignon-- the best piece I've had in a long time.  Again, the chef here is so confident with his/ her skill, you don't even get to be asked about "how would you like it done."  It was just done right, with the right amount of pink inside.  The mashed polenta base was mesmerizingly yummy.

Passion fruit & chocolate cheese cake-- boy...by the time we got to this part, the tummies were honestly packed with satisfaction, and the bodies were in heavenly coma.  I took a few delicious bites and had to take the rest home.

Beautiful experience. 
Grazie mille, Ciao...
And I will definitely be back, with love.
Awesome Italian spot with great breakfast. We came here and got an omelet and oysters and it was fantastic. Brandon was such a great server!

I was attending a week long meeting at the Venetian.  We were looking for dinner and found this restaurant.  The restaurant is open to the Venetian Courtyard where you can look up to see the faux skyline and clouds.  You can enjoy the music from the plaza and people watch as well. It is a pleasant setting.  We were seated in the "outdoor" area of the restaurant and were immediately greeted by our server, Sandra.  Sandra was very thorough; she explained the menu and proceeded to take our order.  Both myself and another patron chose the spaghetti and meatballs and it was excellent.  Sandra made sure our water glasses stayed filled and made sure our wine glasses never got empty either!  The experience was so good we choose to eat there again two days later!  Definitely a good experience with excellent service.  So if you are looking for Italian food in the Venetian, this is definitely a restaurant you should consider.

Tried during their initial opening. Staff great service good but we were oversold in food. The upsale was fast and furious. Normally I don't complain about cost but for what we ordered very over priced. Food just average. Nothing spectacular. I did enjoy the octopus appetizer though. Won't go back.

I've been here a few times. The food is excellent, the proportions are just right. If you sit out in the courtyard it can get very loud if they have the performers.  If you don't mind the singing and performers the sitting in the courtyard is very fun for people watching. The happy hour cocktail is delicious.

Excellent food and atmosphere and same with great service from Emmanuel M, friendly waiter. Location is great. I can enjoy the free she while eating the yummy grill jumbo prawns. Very relaxing place to eat.

We were in Las Vegas with friends celebrating our 15th anniversary. Friends took us here for drinks and dinner. We all absolutely loved every bite of food we were served. The noodles here are fantastic, you can taste how fresh they are. The Alfredo was the best I've ever had... Veggie Pizza, also fantastic. Make sure you have the table made tiramisu and order the cheesecake! Such a great time! Our waiter was so kind and did a great job managing our rather large party. I be coming back the next time we are in Vegas!

This experience was truly one of a kind. An authentic Italian experience accompanied by authentic smiles. From making the reservations with Denise to the stellar service provided by Edward my friends and I experienced a perfect evening on cloud 9 at this restaurant. If I could give 6 stars I would!

Flying solo for the evening, I stopped in to sit at the bar and have a quick bite. Since I checked in I was able to get a free Italian cocktail, which was pretty tasty. I ordered the yellowtail with artichokes and I was not disappointed. It was pretty fresh and well presented and I'm pretty sure I ate every bite. The bread that came on the side was very fresh. 

At the end of my meal I ordered a limoncello and was a little disappointed that for a small shot it was $12 but I guess that's what I get for eating in St. Mark's Square.

Food took forever to come. And when it did it was either under cooked or over cooked. Ceasar salad never showed. Raw steak. Sea bass still cold and raw in the center. So disappointed. Sat there for three hours. Worst meal in Vegas.

Just had a corporate dinner here with colleagues. I wanted something simple so I ordered the Tuna. I was asked how I wanted it cooked and ordered it "rare". What came out was 2 small pieces of very dark (50% mahogany-colored center), overcooked (50% seared grey edges) "mystery meat" sitting in a pool of dark "bitter sauce". It was $34 of blech. On the bright side, the "Night at the Opera" cocktail was excellent.

Went at happy hour and should have ordered off of that menu. Service was extremely slow, and nothing was very good. The total bill was over $200 for the three of us, and there was nothing special about the meal...actually the food was below average.

Wonderful traditional Italian restaurant in the canal shops at the Venetian. Ordered Arugula salad and grilled artichoke w/ marinara sauce to start. Nothing special here. For the main course- bone in ribeye w/ lobster and shrimp. Amazing charred flavor, perfectly wood grilled in shell lobster, split. Huge head on shrimp perfectly grilled. Tender grilled asparagus.  Great Italian dinner!

I came here at 1pm on a recent Sunday planning to eat breakfast/brunch food, but when we got to the restaurant, there was a big push for their new lunch menu and we were only given menus for lunch, not breakfast.  I ended up getting their crispy halibut sandwich which came with an arugula salad.  It was delicious!  Perhaps more bun than fish, but the bread was tasty so it didn't bother me too much.  One of my dining companions ordered from the lunch box section and said the food was good (Caesar salad and halibut) but the portions were too small.  I saw with my own eyes - portions really were tiny for her lunch box.  Just a heads up if you come here hungry!  We did get complimentary bread with our meal which I tried not to eat too much of. 

It was a bit of a disappointment that my reservation requests were ignored.  I requested a booth inside of the restaurant, which was empty, but we were shown a table outside instead.  We asked the hostess for the kind of table we originally wanted and in the end they were able to honor our request.  I very much preferred it inside as it was quiet and the decor was really nice as well.  Plus, we had a great view of the scene "outside" from where we were sitting as the restaurant was pretty open.  I also noted on my reservation that we were celebrating a birthday, but not even a simple happy birthday greeting was given.  Our server was young and upbeat, however, and the free cocktail with Yelp check-in was nice.
Rosso di Montalcino, Eggplant Parmigiana, Caesar salad, Gnocchi Bolognese delish. Ask for Frankie best service. Delish Italian. Feels like Venezia!!!

Wow! Loved the gnocchi here.  I thought I didn't like it until I had it here.  They were little packages of love!  The setting was beautiful but the food was amazing! We asked to speak to the chef. He made time to come and chat with us. He was very kind and professional. You must come even if for just the gnocchi.

Food was delicious! We had a friendly waiter who walked us through the menu and made suggestions. I had the homemade salmon ravioli and my husband had the ribeye. We also had the grilled octopus for an appetizer!
Pricey and not a lot of food but you're in St. Mark's Square.  Really, everything is good.    Just enjoy that you're on vacation or at a work event.

We decided to try this restaurant for early dinner woth my family of 5. I have ate at the other canal restaurants so I decides to give this place a try. Ordered a few appetizers, Ceasars salad, Burretta, fried calamari and a pepperoni pizza. I liked them all except the pizza. The crust was too salty for me. They brought complimentary baggette bread it was so fresh, crusty and went
well with the olive oil and vinegar. For dinner we each ordered pastas, fettuccine alfredo, linguni with seafood, and the table side pasta they make inside the parmigian cheese. Overall the pastas was ok. Also I had checked in on yelp and I told my waiter about the free drink when you check in and he never brought it out. I
was too shy to ask for my free drink the second time. 
For dessert I ordered the tiramisu table side presentation. It was amazing. I recommend that one. All and all I would dine here again but I will try there fresh whole fish. The restaurant was very clean and nicely decorated.

Very good. All the pasta is house made. I was craving pasta with vodka sauce, which is not on the menu, and they were so accommodating and made a delicious vodka sauce just for the dish. David Stern was my wonderful waiter. He was very accommodating and nice. I will definitely be back.

This little hidden gem of a restaurant was delicious!  The service was awesome and our waiter went over and beyond to be friendly and make sure we were happy.  The salad was so fresh and one of the best I've had.  Would come back just for that.  Both my husbands dish and mine were fresh, and so
very good!  Will be coming back again when we want authentic good Italian food!!

Everything was awesome from entering the dining area, to being seated, and especially being served. Our server, Edward made sure we were satisfied with everything. He had the perfect balance of giving my family the attention we needed and giving time to ourselves. Everything about his style of service made our Saturday brunch enjoyable. There was also April, who I believe was a manager. She greeted us at the table and also made sure our table was clear for other dishes to arrive. The food was great and the service was the icing on the cake. Thank you Edward and April.

For either happy hour or dinner, excellent food and service.  The true winning dish is the ravioli with pesto - simple, excellent, and unique.  We've dined here a few times - the service is consistently excellent and the food always a treat!  Can't wait to return.

Nice food, nice Service !!!

Really good Restaurant 

I had the seabass and it was super delicious only thing was that the portion of the side on the plate was tiny.

But the appetizers and drinks were awesome

One of the best Italian place in Venetian/Palazzo. All of their pasta are house made. I recommend EVERYTHING I had. I tried burrata fatta in casa, taguatelle verdi, tiramisu, and homemade cookies. The meatballs in taguatelle dish was delicious. And the desserts were even better! They just melt in your mouth. Plus, our server David Stern was amazing. so friendly and i felt very welcomed. I would definitely come back and would love to come back with my family.

We flew from Seattle, ostensibly because we had a wonderful experience at this restaurant back in October and we had a few days and Mercato Della Pescheria was our goal.
Again, the restaurant did not disappoint.  My steak prepared in their Josper  oven was superb.  Our server, Martina D., could not have been more accommodating to our requests and quirky dietary needs.  We loved her and we loved our experience.
Well worth the trip.

Stumbled across this place during the awkward in between time (3-6pm) and boy, what a pleasant surprise! They've been open LESS THAN A FEW WEEKS, and like any new restaurant, you expect kinks... But not this place! Service at the bar with Matt and Gustavo was outstanding. Better yet, Happy Hour menu was generous, best I've seen. 50% off wines, pizza, meat and cheese platters. Try the white pizza with shrimp and arugula. Tasty, a lot of flavor and the shrimp did not overpower. We can't wait to come back!
Fantastic seafood and pasta. A minor problem with the food and they took care of it. Great service

Food great service great nice friendly staff highly recommend our waitress Udelle always had a smile and always checked on us highly recommend defiantly will come back again. The food is some of the best Italian in Vegas you won't be disappointed!! Best part? Fresh tiramisu right at your table for dessert !!
Authentic Italian Seafood restaurant. Mediterranean Seafood Risotto and Linguini with Calms we're both amazing dishes. Fresh bread and Pino Grigio perfection. Atmosphere and service outstanding!
Food is really good. Brandon is very nice he keeps checking in with us and gave us tips of fun things in vegas. Will definitely come here again.
Mario was the best!! Thanks for making our 25th wedding anniversary special! The food, service and atmosphere was amazing! We'll definitely be back.

What a wonderful experience! I really wanted to have lunch in piazza San Marco since I already knew it was going to be amazing. I swear, the atmosphere here is magic, really reminds me of Venice, just without pigeons. 

The staff is so welcoming and nice! We sat at a table on a Monday afternoon and the manager, Alessio, immediately greeted us in Italian. Che meraviglia! 

The menu is not extensive but variegated. I got the half panino con prosciutto crudo San Daniele with a side of tuna tartar and my friend got the gnocchi alla sorrentina. How delicious! All the ingredients are fresh and the gnocchi were made in house. Oh oh and the burrata was the touché! It comes with a truffle oil and tomatoes, a great combination of flavors. 

An espresso was just what we needed to end this great meal. 

This is how an Italian from Italy likes to eat: fresh delicious food, good company, warm staff, and a characteristic ambience that recalls your origins. 
Here, the sky is always blue. Ci ritornerò molto volentieri, buon appetito! :)

We just stopped in for a quick lunch.  The service was great. We explained that we were going out that night  to another restaurant and that we did not want anything heavy and he helped out with the selection of octopus which was fantastic.  The octopus was flavorful and mixed perfectly the pesto type sauce and celery and roasted potatoes.

My wife and I then split the Mediterranean Sea Bass which was exquisite.  It was roasted in a paper shell with spinach, potatoes, nuts and grape tomatoes.

As far as price- it's not a cheap but you know that going in.  I think for the quality of food and service it is worth the price.

Great little restaurant at the Venetian Hotel

Check-in on Yelp for a free cocktail coupon! 

This is one of the stops on the "Food Tours of America" Food and Dessert Tour and has quickly become one of my favorite spots in the Venetian! 

Located in the heart of St. Marks Square, the ambience pays homage to authentic marketplaces in Italy. They make their pasta in-house every day and when you try it, you can definitely tell! 

Favorite item on the menu? The Table Side Tiramisu. That's right: TABLE SIDE TIRAMISU. Just like ordering table side guac, they roll out with a little cart and make that sucker right in front of you. They drench the ladyfingers in espresso, whip the marscapone cheese, pour it over the ladyfingers and finish it off by hand grating the chocolate on top. It is a MUST try! The consistency is less creamy than traditional "set" tiramisu, but it truly is worth licking the bowl for. 

If tiramisu isn't your thing, the ricotta cheesecake is also a creamy wonderland of decadence!  

As for dinner, the meatballs are the smoothest, most velvety creation I've ever tasted and their Swiss Chard Ravioli is a treat enough to share or keep to yourself! (Tip: save some of the table bread and dip it in the pesto cream sauce!) 

If you sit on the patio, you'll have a great seat for the street-performers every half hour (opera singers, jugglers, human statues, musicians etc) but these performances do draw a crowd and reverberate throughout the Square, so if you're looking for a more intimate evening, I'd opt to sit further inside.

Came here for happy hour which is from 3pm to 6pm. Love the HH! Great selections of drinks for only $7. There's not many options for HH appetizers, I think you have about an option of 5 different things which are mostly seafood. So far I got the calamari and steamed mussels which were fantastic, the HH appetizers were $7 each as well.

Located within Grand Canal Shoppes at The Venetian, it's one of a few restaurants among the shops in the very well done (pseudo, of course), St. Mark's Square.  This version of St. Mark's may not be the original, but it's way cleaner and without pigeons or their leave behind excrements.

Under a lovely painted perfect blue sky, a classical trio, and the faux outdoor dining -- awesome.  A bit Disney, perhaps, but they've captured many of the senses to the real thing in Venice.

My gf and I sat at one of the "outdoor" tables, and was served by Udelle who was the utmost pro - lovely, conversational, laid back, and totally set the tone for the night.

The menu had a wonderful mix of Italian specialities and fish...and so many tempting and pleasing choices.  We proceeded to order (after chomping on amazing fresh and warm bread):

1.  Meatballs Appetizer [$14 for 3 balls, 4.0 stars] -- I gotta have them!  A little overpriced, but a great ball (and I don't say that to many places).  I loved the sauce, it was a great starter for things to come.

2.  Mama's Lasagna [$25, 4.5 stars] -- Tasted freshness all the way and one of the best I've had (mine's better).  Would have preferred the noodles to be thinner, but excellent nonetheless.

3.  Chicken Pesto Pasta [$26, 4.0 stars] -- we asked for creamy pesto, and we got it.  Nice portion, but a little on the boring side.  Needed veg or pine nuts, or something to break up the monotony.

Overall, it was very enjoyable and I'd definitely be up to coming back.
